Title:Windows 10 Security Technical Implementation Guide
Description:This Security Technical Implementation Guide is published as a tool to improve the security of Department of Defense (DoD) information systems. The requirements are derived from the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-53 and related documents. Comments or proposed revisions to this document should be sent via email to the following address: disa.stig_spt@mail.mil.

    • The Create a pagefile user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Create a token object user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Create global objects user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Create permanent shared objects user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Create symbolic links user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Debug programs user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000080-GPOS-00048
    • The Deny access to this computer from the network user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems. - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000080-GPOS-00048
    • The Deny log on as a batch job user right on domain-joined workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000080-GPOS-00048
    • The Deny log on as a service user right on Windows 10 domain-joined workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000080-GPOS-00048
    • The Deny log on locally user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems. - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000080-GPOS-00048
    • The Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services user right on Windows 10 workstations must at a minimum be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems. - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Force shutdown from a remote system user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Impersonate a client after authentication user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Load and unload device drivers user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Lock pages in memory user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027
    • The Manage auditing and security log user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Modify firmware environment values user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Perform volume maintenance tasks user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Profile single process user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Restore files and directories user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Fail
  • SRG-OS-000324-GPOS-00125
    • The Take ownership of files or other objects user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
  • SRG-OS-000041
    • PowerShell Transcription must be enabled on Windows 10. - Pass

Detailed Results

Domain-joined systems must use Windows 10 Enterprise Edition 64-bit version.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220697r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-00-000005
Identities:V-63319
SV-77809
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Features such as Credential Guard use virtualization based security to protect information that could be used in credential theft attacks if compromised. There are a number of system requirements that must be met in order for Credential Guard to be configured and enabled properly. Virtualization based security and Credential Guard are only available with Windows 10 Enterprise 64-bit version. false
Fix Text:Use Windows 10 Enterprise 64-bit version for domain-joined systems.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:15
Result:true
Title:Domain-joined systems must use Windows 10 Enterprise Edition 64-bit version.
Description:Domain-joined systems must use Windows 10 Enterprise Edition 64-bit version.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (OSArchitecture is 64-bit)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (EditionID is Enterprise or EnterpriseS)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (DomainRole is 0 or 2)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:1500 (wmi57_test)
Result:true
Title:OSArchitecture is 64-bit
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:1500 (wmi57_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT OSArchitecture FROM Win32_OperatingSystem'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:1500 (wmi57_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all 'result' the following must be true:
    • at least one osarchitecture must be equal to '64-bit'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT OSArchitecture FROM Win32_OperatingSystem'
  • collected 'result' result:
    • osarchitecture = '64-bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:8300 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:EditionID is Enterprise or EnterpriseS
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:8300 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name must be equal to 'EditionId'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:8300 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to 'Enterprise'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:8301 (registry_state)

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to 'EnterpriseS'

  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name equals 'EditionId'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252090000000'
  • type equals 'reg_sz'
  • value equals 'Enterprise'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Result:true

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:8200 (wmi_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT DomainRole FROM Win32_ComputerSystem'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:8200 (wmi_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', result must be equal to '0'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:8201 (wmi_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', result must be equal to '2'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT DomainRole FROM Win32_ComputerSystem'
  • result equals '0'

Windows 10 information systems must use BitLocker to encrypt all disks to protect the confidentiality and integrity of all information at rest.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220702r569228_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-00-000030
Identities:SV-77827
V-63337
CCI-001199 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-28; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-28.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-28)
CCI-002475 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-28 (1))
CCI-002476 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-28 (1))
Description: If data at rest is unencrypted, it is vulnerable to disclosure. Even if the operating system enforces permissions on data access, an adversary can remove non-volatile memory and read it directly, thereby circumventing operating system controls. Encrypting the data ensures that confidentiality is protected even when the operating system is not running. false
Fix Text:Enable full disk encryption on all information systems (including SIPRNet) using BitLocker.

BitLocker, included in Windows, can be enabled in the Control Panel under "BitLocker Drive Encryption" as well as other management tools.

NOTE: An alternate encryption application may be used in lieu of BitLocker providing it is configured for full disk encryption and satisfies the pre-boot authentication requirements (WN10-00-000031 and WN10-00-000032).
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:177
Result:false
Title:BitLocker must be enabled on all fixed drives.
Description:BitLocker must be enabled on all fixed drives.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (BitLocker must be enabled on all fixed drives.)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:17700 (wmi57_test)
Result:false
Title:BitLocker must be enabled on all fixed drives.
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:17700 (wmi57_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2\security\microsoftvolumeencryption'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT protectionstatus FROM win32_encryptablevolume'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:17700 (wmi57_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all 'result' the following must be true:
    • all protectionstatus must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2\security\microsoftvolumeencryption'
  • wql equals 'SELECT protectionstatus FROM win32_encryptablevolume'
  • collected 'result' result:
    • protectionstatus = '0'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

Windows 10 systems must be maintained at a supported servicing level.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220706r569217_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-00-000040
Identities:V-63349
SV-77839
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Windows 10 is maintained by Microsoft at servicing levels for specific periods of time to support Windows as a Service. Systems at unsupported servicing levels or releases will not receive security updates for new vulnerabilities which leaves them subject to exploitation.

New versions with feature updates are planned to be released on a semi-annual basis with an estimated support timeframe of 18 to 30 months depending on the release. Support for previously released versions has been extended for Enterprise editions.

A separate servicing branch intended for special purpose systems is the Long-Term Servicing Channel (LTSC, formerly Branch - LTSB) which will receive security updates for 10 years but excludes feature updates. false
Fix Text:Update systems on the Semi-Annual Channel to "Microsoft Windows Version 1803 (OS Build 17134.0)" or greater.

It is recommended systems be upgraded to the most recently released version.

Special purpose systems using the Long-Term Servicing Branch\Channel (LTSC\B) may be at the following versions:

v1507 (Build 10240)
v1607 (Build 14393)
v1809 (Build 17763)
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:109
Result:true
Title:WN10-00-000040 - Windows 10 systems must be maintained at a supported servicing level
Description:Windows 10 is maintained by Microsoft at servicing levels for specific periods of time to support Windows as a Service. Systems at unsupported servicing levels or releases will not receive security updates for new vulnerabilities which leaves them subject to exploitation. New versions with feature updates are planned to be released on a semi-annual basis with an estimated support timeframe of 18 to 30 months depending on the release. Support for previously released versions has been extended for Enterprise editions. A separate servicing branch intended for special purpose systems is the Long-Term Servicing Channel (LTSC, formerly Branch - LTSB) which will receive security updates for 10 years but excludes feature updates.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (The OS Version is equal to or greater than 6.3)
      • true (The OS Build is equal to or greater than 17134.0)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (The OS is Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB)
      • true (The OS Build is equal to or greater than 10240)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:10900 (registry_test)
Result:true

  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name must be equal to 'CurrentVersion'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:10900 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than or equal to '6.3'

  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name equals 'CurrentVersion'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252090000000'
  • type equals 'reg_sz'

Local volumes must be formatted using NTFS.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220708r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-00-000050
Identities:V-63353
SV-77843
CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3)
Description: The ability to set access permissions and auditing is critical to maintaining the security and proper access controls of a system. To support this, volumes must be formatted using the NTFS file system. false
Fix Text:Format all local volumes to use NTFS.
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:30
Result:true
Title:Local volumes must be formatted using NTFS.
Description:Local volumes must be formatted using NTFS.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true (Local volumes use NTFS)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:3000 (wmi_test)
Result:true
Title:Local volumes use NTFS
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:3000 (wmi_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT deviceid FROM win32_logicaldisk WHERE drivetype=3 AND filesystem!="NTFS"'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT deviceid FROM win32_logicaldisk WHERE drivetype=3 AND filesystem!="NTFS"'
  • result does not exist

Accounts must be configured to require password expiration.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220716r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-00-000090
Identities:V-63371
SV-77861
CCI-000199 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (d); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (d))
Description: Passwords that do not expire increase exposure with a greater probability of being discovered or cracked. false
Fix Text:Configure all passwords to expire.
Run "Computer Management".
Navigate to System Tools >> Local Users and Groups >> Users.
Double click each active account.
Ensure "Password never expires" is not checked on all active accounts.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:77
Result:true
Title:Accounts must be configured to require password expiration.
Description:Accounts must be configured to require password expiration.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true (No active, local accounts have non-expiring passwords.)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:7700 (wmi_test)
Result:true
Title:No active, local accounts have non-expiring passwords.
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:7700 (wmi_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT name FROM Win32_UserAccount WHERE LocalAccount=TRUE AND Disabled=FALSE AND PasswordExpires=FALSE'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT name FROM Win32_UserAccount WHERE LocalAccount=TRUE AND Disabled=FALSE AND PasswordExpires=FALSE'
  • result does not exist

Internet Information System (IIS) or its subcomponents must not be installed on a workstation.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220718r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-00-000100
Identities:V-63377
SV-77867
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: Installation of Internet Information System (IIS) may allow unauthorized internet services to be hosted. Websites must only be hosted on servers that have been designed for that purpose and can be adequately secured. false
Fix Text:Uninstall "Internet Information Services" or "Internet Information Services Hostable Web Core" from the system.

Weight:10.0

Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10

Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) must not be installed on the system.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220719r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-00-000105
Identities:SV-77871
V-63381
CCI-000382 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (iii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 b)
Description: Some protocols and services do not support required security features, such as encrypting passwords or traffic. false
Fix Text:Uninstall "Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP)" from the system.

Run "Programs and Features".
Select "Turn Windows Features on or off".
De-select "Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP)".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:55
Result:true
Title:Unnecessary Features Installed - SNMP
Description:SNMP feature is not installed
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true (SNMP feature is not installed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:5500 (file_test)
Result:true
Title:SNMP feature is not installed
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:5500 (file_object)
Object Requirements:
  • for path, all of the following must be true:
    • path must be equal to 'C:\Windows\System32'
  • filename must be equal (case insensitive) to 'snmp.exe'

Simple TCP/IP Services must not be installed on the system.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220720r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-00-000110
Identities:SV-77873
V-63383
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: Some protocols and services do not support required security features, such as encrypting passwords or traffic. false
Fix Text:Uninstall "Simple TCPIP Services (i.e. echo, daytime etc)" from the system.

Run "Programs and Features".
Select "Turn Windows Features on or off".
De-select "Simple TCPIP Services (i.e. echo, daytime etc)".

Weight:10.0

  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true (simptcp service not installed)

Result:true

Data Execution Prevention (DEP) must be configured to at least OptOut.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220726r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-00-000145
Identities:SV-83439
V-68845
CCI-002824 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-16)
Description: Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. Data Execution Prevention (DEP) prevents harmful code from running in protected memory locations reserved for Windows and other programs. false
Fix Text:Configure DEP to at least OptOut.

Note: Suspend BitLocker before making changes to the DEP configuration.

Open a command prompt (cmd.exe) or PowerShell with elevated privileges (Run as administrator).
Enter "BCDEDIT /set {current} nx OptOut". (If using PowerShell "{current}" must be enclosed in quotes.)
"AlwaysOn", a more restrictive selection, is also valid but does not allow applications that do not function properly to be opted out of DEP.

Opted out exceptions can be configured in the "System Properties".

Open "System" in Control Panel.
Select "Advanced system settings".
Click "Settings" in the "Performance" section.
Select the "Data Execution Prevention" tab.
Applications that are opted out are configured in the window below the selection "Turn on DEP for all programs and services except those I select:".
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:121
Result:false
Title:Data Execution Prevention (DEP) must be configured to at least Opt Out.
Description:Data Execution Prevention (DEP) must be configured to at least Opt Out.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (DEP is set to 'OptOut')
      • false (DEP is set to 'AlwaysOn')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:12000 (wmi57_test)
Result:false
Title:DEP is set to 'OptOut'
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:12000 (wmi57_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT dataexecutionprevention_supportpolicy FROM win32_operatingsystem'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:12000 (wmi57_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all 'result' the following must be true:
    • at least one dataexecutionprevention_supportpolicy must be equal to '3'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT dataexecutionprevention_supportpolicy FROM win32_operatingsystem'
  • collected 'result' result:
    • dataexecutionprevention_supportpolicy = '2'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:12001 (wmi57_test)
Result:false
Title:DEP is set to 'AlwaysOn'
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:12000 (wmi57_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT dataexecutionprevention_supportpolicy FROM win32_operatingsystem'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:12001 (wmi57_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all 'result' the following must be true:
    • at least one dataexecutionprevention_supportpolicy must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT dataexecutionprevention_supportpolicy FROM win32_operatingsystem'
  • collected 'result' result:
    • dataexecutionprevention_supportpolicy = '2'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

Structured Exception Handling Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) must be enabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220727r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-00-000150
Identities:V-68849
SV-83445
CCI-002824 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-16)
Description: Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. Structured Exception Handling Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) blocks exploits that use the Structured Exception Handling overwrite technique, a common buffer overflow attack. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Enable Structured Exception Handling Overwrite Protection (SEHOP)" to "Enabled".

This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:123
Result:true
Title:WN10-00-000150
Description:Structured Exception Handling Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) must be turned on.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true (SEHOP is turned on and properly configured)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (Windows 10 release id is 1709 or newer)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:12300 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:SEHOP is turned on and properly configured
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:12300 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\kernel'
  • name must be equal to 'DisableExceptionChainValidation'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:12300 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\kernel'
  • name equals 'DisableExceptionChainValidation'
  • last_write_time equals '132629232850000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:17200 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:Windows 10 release id is 1709 or newer
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:17200 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name must be equal to 'ReleaseId'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:17200 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than or equal to '1709'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name equals 'ReleaseId'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252090000000'
  • type equals 'reg_sz'
  • value equals '2009'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The Windows PowerShell 2.0 feature must be disabled on the system.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220728r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-00-000155
Identities:V-70637
SV-85259
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: Windows PowerShell 5.0 added advanced logging features which can provide additional detail when malware has been run on a system. Disabling the Windows PowerShell 2.0 mitigates against a downgrade attack that evades the Windows PowerShell 5.0 script block logging feature. false
Fix Text:Disable "Windows PowerShell 2.0" on the system.

Run "Windows PowerShell" with elevated privileges (run as administrator).
Enter the following:
Disable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2Root

This command should disable both "MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2Root" and "MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2" which correspond to "Windows PowerShell 2.0" and "Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine" respectively in "Turn Windows features on or off".

Alternately:
Search for "Features".
Select "Turn Windows features on or off".
De-select "Windows PowerShell 2.0".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:140
Result:false
Title:WN10-00-000155
Description:The Windows PowerShell 2.0 feature must be disabled on the system.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (Windows PowerShell 2.0 optional feature is disabled)
      • false (Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine optional feature is disabled)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:14000 (wmi57_test)
Result:false
Title:Windows PowerShell 2.0 optional feature is disabled
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:14000 (wmi57_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2Root''
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:14000 (wmi57_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all 'result' the following must be true:
    • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2Root''
  • collected 'result' result:
    • installstate = '1'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:14001 (wmi57_test)
Result:false
Title:Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine optional feature is disabled
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:14001 (wmi57_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2''
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:14000 (wmi57_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all 'result' the following must be true:
    • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2''
  • collected 'result' result:
    • installstate = '1'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the system.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220729r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-00-000160
Identities:V-70639
SV-85261
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.

Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older Network Attached Storage (NAS) devices may only support SMBv1. false
Fix Text:Disable the SMBv1 protocol.

Run "Windows PowerShell" with elevated privileges (run as administrator).

Enter the following:
Disable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName SMB1Protocol

Alternately:
Search for "Features".

Select "Turn Windows features on or off".

De-select "SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:141
Result:true
Title:WN10-00-000160
Description:The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the system.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled')
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Configure SMBv1 client driver' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Disable driver (recommended)' selected for 'Configure MrxSmb10 driver')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:16800 (wmi57_test)
Result:true
Title:'SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:16800 (wmi57_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all 'result' the following must be true:
    • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
  • collected 'result' result:
    • installstate = '2'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:16900 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:16900 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters'
  • name must be equal to 'SMB1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:16900 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters'
  • name equals 'SMB1'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252070000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:17000 (registry_test)

Title:'Configure SMBv1 client driver' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Disable driver (recommended)' selected for 'Configure MrxSmb10 driver'

  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10'
  • name must be equal to 'Start'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:17000 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '4'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10'
  • name equals 'Start'
  • last_write_time equals '132629232850000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '4'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB server.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220730r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-00-000165
Identities:V-74723
SV-89397
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.

Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older network attached devices may only support SMBv1. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Configure SMBv1 Server" to "Disabled".

This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.

The system must be restarted for the change to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:166
Result:true
Title:WN10-00-000165
Description:The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB server.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled')
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:16900 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:16900 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters'
  • name must be equal to 'SMB1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:16900 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters'
  • name equals 'SMB1'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252070000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:16800 (wmi57_test)
Result:true
Title:'SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:16800 (wmi57_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:16800 (wmi57_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all 'result' the following must be true:
    • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
  • collected 'result' result:
    • installstate = '2'

The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB client.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220731r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-00-000170
Identities:V-74725
SV-89399
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.

Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older network attached devices may only support SMBv1. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Configure SMBv1 client driver" to "Enabled" with "Disable driver (recommended)" selected for "Configure MrxSmb10 driver".

This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.

The system must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:167
Result:true
Title:WN10-00-000170
Description:The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB client.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Configure SMBv1 client driver' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Disable driver (recommended)' selected for 'Configure MrxSmb10 driver')
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:17000 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Configure SMBv1 client driver' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Disable driver (recommended)' selected for 'Configure MrxSmb10 driver'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:17000 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10'
  • name must be equal to 'Start'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:17000 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '4'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10'
  • name equals 'Start'
  • last_write_time equals '132629232850000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '4'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:16800 (wmi57_test)
Result:true
Title:'SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:16800 (wmi57_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:16800 (wmi57_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all 'result' the following must be true:
    • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
  • collected 'result' result:
    • installstate = '2'

The Secondary Logon service must be disabled on Windows 10.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220732r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-00-000175
Identities:V-74719
SV-89393
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: The Secondary Logon service provides a means for entering alternate credentials, typically used to run commands with elevated privileges. Using privileged credentials in a standard user session can expose those credentials to theft. false
Fix Text:Configure the "Secondary Logon" service "Startup Type" to "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:165
Result:false
Title:WN10-00-000175
Description:The Secondary Logon service must be disabled on Windows 10.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (The Secondary Logon service Startup Type is Disabled or the service is uninstalled)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:16500 (wmi57_test)
Result:false
Title:The Secondary Logon service Startup Type is Disabled or the service is uninstalled
Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
Check:At least one collected item must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:16500 (wmi57_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT startmode FROM Win32_Service WHERE name='seclogon''
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:16500 (wmi57_state)
State Requirements:
  • for all 'result' the following must be true:
    • all startmode must be equal to 'Disabled'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT startmode FROM Win32_Service WHERE name='seclogon''
  • collected 'result' result:
    • startmode = 'Manual'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

Windows 10 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220739r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-AC-000005
Identities:V-63405
SV-77895
CCI-002238 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-7 b)
Description: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the amount of time that an account will remain locked after the specified number of failed logon attempts. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> "Account lockout duration" to "15" minutes or greater.

A value of "0" is also acceptable, requiring an administrator to unlock the account.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:3931
Result:false
Title:Lockout Duration
Description:Lockout duration must meet minimum requirements.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false ('Account lockout duration' is set to '0')
      • false ('Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0')
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Account lockout duration' is set to '15 minutes' or greater)
      • false ('Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:393100 (lockoutpolicy_test)
Result:false
Title:'Account lockout duration' is set to '0'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:393200 (lockoutpolicy_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:393100 (lockoutpolicy_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_duration must be less than or equal to '0'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:393101 (lockoutpolicy_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_duration must be equal to '4294967295'
Collected Item Properties:
  • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
  • lockout_duration equals '1800'
  • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
  • lockout_threshold equals '0'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:393201 (lockoutpolicy_test)
Result:false
Title:'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:393200 (lockoutpolicy_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:393201 (lockoutpolicy_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_threshold must be greater than '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
  • lockout_duration equals '1800'
  • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
  • lockout_threshold equals '0'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:393101 (lockoutpolicy_test)
Result:true
Title:'Account lockout duration' is set to '15 minutes' or greater
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:393200 (lockoutpolicy_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:393102 (lockoutpolicy_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_duration must be greater than or equal to '900'
Collected Item Properties:
  • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
  • lockout_duration equals '1800'
  • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
  • lockout_threshold equals '0'

The number of allowed bad logon attempts must be configured to 3 or less.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220740r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-AC-000010
Identities:SV-77899
V-63409
CCI-000044 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-7 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-7 a)
Description: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. The higher this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system. The number of bad logon attempts must be reasonably small to minimize the possibility of a successful password attack, while allowing for honest errors made during a normal user logon. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> "Account lockout threshold" to "3" or less invalid logon attempts (excluding "0" which is unacceptable).
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:3932
Result:false
Title:Bad Logon Attempts
Description:The number of allowed bad logon attempts must meet minimum requirements.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Account lockout threshold' is set to '3' or less)
    • false ('Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:393200 (lockoutpolicy_test)
Result:true
Title:'Account lockout threshold' is set to '3' or less
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:393200 (lockoutpolicy_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:393200 (lockoutpolicy_state)
State Requirements:
  • for check = 'all', lockout_threshold, the following must be true:
    • lockout_threshold must be less than or equal to '3'
Collected Item Properties:
  • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
  • lockout_duration equals '1800'
  • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
  • lockout_threshold equals '0'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:393201 (lockoutpolicy_test)
Result:false
Title:'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:393200 (lockoutpolicy_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:393201 (lockoutpolicy_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_threshold must be greater than '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
  • lockout_duration equals '1800'
  • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
  • lockout_threshold equals '0'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

The period of time before the bad logon counter is reset must be configured to 15 minutes.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220741r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-AC-000015
Identities:SV-77903
V-63413
CCI-000044 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-7 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-7 a)
CCI-002238 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-7 b)
Description: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the period of time that must pass after failed logon attempts before the counter is reset to 0. The smaller this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> "Reset account lockout counter after" to "15" minutes.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0

The password history must be configured to 24 passwords remembered.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220742r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-AC-000020
Identities:SV-77905
V-63415
CCI-000200 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (e); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (e))
Description: A system is more vulnerable to unauthorized access when system users recycle the same password several times without being required to change a password to a unique password on a regularly scheduled basis. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes. The default value is 24 for Windows domain systems. DoD has decided this is the appropriate value for all Windows systems. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Enforce password history" to "24" passwords remembered.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:3934
Result:false
Title:Password Uniqueness
Description:Password uniqueness must meet minimum requirements.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Enforce password history' is set to '24' passwords or more)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:393400 (passwordpolicy_test)
Result:false
Title:'Enforce password history' is set to '24' passwords or more
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:393500 (passwordpolicy_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:393400 (passwordpolicy_state)
State Requirements:
  • for check = 'all', password_hist_len, the following must be true:
    • password_hist_len must be greater than or equal to '24'
Collected Item Properties:
  • max_passwd_age equals '4294967295'
  • min_passwd_age equals '0'
  • min_passwd_len equals '0'
  • password_hist_len equals '0'
  • password_complexity equals '0'
  • reversible_encryption equals '0'
  • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

The maximum password age must be configured to 60 days or less.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220743r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-AC-000025
Identities:SV-77909
V-63419
CCI-000199 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (d); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (d))
Description: The longer a password is in use, the greater the opportunity for someone to gain unauthorized knowledge of the passwords. Scheduled changing of passwords hinders the ability of unauthorized system users to crack passwords and gain access to a system. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Maximum Password Age" to "60" days or less (excluding "0" which is unacceptable).
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072

    • false ('Maximum Password Age' is set to '60' days or less)
    • true ('Maximum Password Age' is not set to '0')

  • Collect any available items.

  • for check = 'all', max_passwd_age, the following must be true:
    • max_passwd_age must be less than or equal to '5184000'

  • min_passwd_age equals '0'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', max_passwd_age must be greater than '0'

  • max_passwd_age equals '4294967295'
  • min_passwd_age equals '0'
  • min_passwd_len equals '0'
  • password_hist_len equals '0'

  • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

The minimum password age must be configured to at least 1 day.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220744r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-AC-000030
Identities:SV-77911
V-63421
CCI-000198 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (d); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (d))
Description: Permitting passwords to be changed in immediate succession within the same day allows users to cycle passwords through their history database. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Minimum Password Age" to at least "1" day.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072

    • min_passwd_age must be greater than or equal to '86400'

  • min_passwd_age equals '0'
  • min_passwd_len equals '0'
  • password_hist_len equals '0'

  • reversible_encryption equals '0'
  • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

Passwords must, at a minimum, be 14 characters.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220745r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-AC-000035
Identities:SV-77913
V-63423
CCI-000205 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (i); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
Description: Information systems not protected with strong password schemes (including passwords of minimum length) provide the opportunity for anyone to crack the password, thus gaining access to the system and compromising the device, information, or the local network. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Minimum password length" to "14" characters.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:

    • false ('Minimum password length' is set to at least '14' characters)

  • Collect any available items.

    • min_passwd_len must be greater than or equal to '14'

  • min_passwd_age equals '0'
  • min_passwd_len equals '0'
  • password_hist_len equals '0'
  • password_complexity equals '0'
  • reversible_encryption equals '0'
  • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

The built-in Microsoft password complexity filter must be enabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220746r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-AC-000040
Identities:SV-77917
V-63427
CCI-000192 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
CCI-000193 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
CCI-000194 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
CCI-001619 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
Description: The use of complex passwords increases their strength against guessing and brute-force attacks. This setting configures the system to verify that newly created passwords conform to the Windows password complexity policy. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Password must meet complexity requirements" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:3938
Result:false
Title:Microsoft Strong Password Filtering
Description:The built-in Microsoft password complexity filter must be enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Password must meet complexity requirements' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:393800 (passwordpolicy_test)
Result:false
Title:'Password must meet complexity requirements' is set to 'Enabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:393500 (passwordpolicy_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:393800 (passwordpolicy_state)
State Requirements:
  • for check = 'all', password_complexity, the following must be true:
    • password_complexity must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • max_passwd_age equals '4294967295'
  • min_passwd_age equals '0'
  • min_passwd_len equals '0'
  • password_hist_len equals '0'
  • password_complexity equals '0'
  • reversible_encryption equals '0'
  • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

Reversible password encryption must be disabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220747r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AC-000045
Identities:V-63429
SV-77919
CCI-000196 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (c); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (c))
Description: Storing passwords using reversible encryption is essentially the same as storing clear-text versions of the passwords. For this reason, this policy must never be enabled. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Store passwords using reversible encryption" to "Disabled".
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:

Result:true
Title:Reversible Password Encryption
Description:Reversible password encryption must be disabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Store password using reversible encryption' is set to 'Disabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:393900 (passwordpolicy_test)
Result:true

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:393900 (passwordpolicy_state)

  • for check = 'all', reversible_encryption, the following must be true:
    • reversible_encryption must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • max_passwd_age equals '4294967295'
  • min_passwd_age equals '0'
  • min_passwd_len equals '0'
  • password_hist_len equals '0'
  • password_complexity equals '0'
  • reversible_encryption equals '0'
  • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

The system must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation failures.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220748r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000005
Identities:V-63431
SV-77921
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Credential validation records events related to validation tests on credentials for a user account logon. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Logon >> "Audit Credential Validation" with "Failure" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:3940
Result:true
Title:Audit - Credential Validation - Failure
Description:The system must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation failures.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Audit Credential Validation' is set to 'Failure')
    • true ('Audit Credential Validation' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')

The system must be configured to audit Account Management - Security Group Management successes.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220750r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000030
Identities:V-63445
SV-77935
CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
CCI-001404 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
CCI-001405 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9))
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Security Group Management records events such as creating, deleting or changing of security groups, including changes in group members. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> "Audit Security Group Management" with "Success" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:3945
Result:true
Title:Audit - Security Group Management - Success
Description:The system must be configured to audit Account Management - Security Group Management successes.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Audit Security Group Management' is set to 'Success')
    • false ('Audit Security Group Management' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:394500 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
Result:true
Title:'Audit Security Group Management' is set to 'Success'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:394100 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.

The system must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management failures.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220751r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000035
Identities:V-63447
SV-77937
CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9))
CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
CCI-001405 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
CCI-001404 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

User Account Management records events such as creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling user accounts. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> "Audit User Account Management" with "Failure" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:3946
Result:true
Title:Audit - User Account Management - Failure
Description:The system must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management failures.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Audit User Account Management' is set to 'Failure')
    • true ('Audit User Account Management' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
Tests:

  • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_logon_logoff_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • application_generated equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • certification_services equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • detailed_file_share equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
  • file_share equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • filtering_platform_connection equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • filtering_platform_packet_drop equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • handle_manipulation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • kernel_object equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_object_access_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • registry equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • sam equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • removable_storage equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • central_access_policy_staging equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

  • authentication_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • authorization_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • mpssvc_rule_level_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • other_policy_change_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • non_sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_privilege_use_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • ipsec_driver equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
  • other_system_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • security_state_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

The system must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Process Creation successes.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220754r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000050
Identities:V-63453
SV-77943
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-001814 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1))
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Process creation records events related to the creation of a process and the source. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Detailed Tracking >> "Audit Process Creation" with "Success" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:3948
Result:true
Title:Audit - Process Creation - Success
Description:The system must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Process Creation successes.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Audit Process Creation' is set to 'Success')
    • false ('Audit Process Creation' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:394800 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)

Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Account Lockout failures.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220755r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000054
Identities:SV-86383
V-71759
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Account Lockout events can be used to identify potentially malicious logon attempts. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Account Lockout" with "Failure" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0

The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Logoff successes.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220757r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000065
Identities:SV-77951
V-63459
CCI-000067 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (1).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Logoff records user logoffs. If this is an interactive logoff, it is recorded on the local system. If it is to a network share, it is recorded on the system accessed. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Logoff" with "Success" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:

  • ipsec_driver equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
  • other_system_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • security_state_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:394901 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
Result:false
Title:'Audit Logoff' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', logoff must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
Collected Item Properties:
  • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

  • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_logon_logoff_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • application_generated equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • certification_services equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • detailed_file_share equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'

  • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

  • sam equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • removable_storage equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • central_access_policy_staging equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

  • authorization_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
