  • other_policy_change_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • non_sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_privilege_use_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • ipsec_driver equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
  • other_system_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • security_state_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Logon failures.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220758r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000070
Identities:V-63463
SV-77953
CCI-000067 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (1).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (1))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Logon records user logons. If this is an interactive logon, it is recorded on the local system. If it is to a network share, it is recorded on the system accessed. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Logon" with "Failure" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:3950
Result:true
Title:Audit - Logon - Failure
Description:The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Logon failures.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Audit Logon' is set to 'Failure')
    • true ('Audit Logon' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
Tests:

The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Special Logon successes.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220760r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000080
Identities:SV-77959
V-63469
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Special Logon records special logons which have administrative privileges and can be used to elevate processes. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Special Logon" with "Success" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:3952
Result:true
Title:Audit - Special Logon - Success
Description:The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Special Logon successes.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Audit Special Logon' is set to 'Success')
    • false ('Audit Special Logon' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:395200 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
Result:true
Title:'Audit Special Logon' is set to 'Success'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:394100 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)

  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:395200 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', special_logon must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
Collected Item Properties:
  • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_account_logon_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • application_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • computer_account_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

Windows 10 must be configured to audit Object Access - File Share failures.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220761r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000081
Identities:CCE-50123-9
SV-89701
V-75027
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Auditing file shares records events related to connection to shares on a system including system shares such as C$. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> "Audit File Share" with "Failure" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:160
Result:true
Title:WN10-AU-000081
Description:The system must be configured to audit Object Access - File Share failures.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Audit File Share' is set to 'Failure')
    • true ('Audit File Share' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:16000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)

Title:'Audit File Share' is set to 'Failure'

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220763r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000083
Identities:CCE-48005-3
V-74411
SV-89085
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Auditing for other object access records events related to the management of task scheduler jobs and COM+ objects. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> "Audit Other Object Access Events" with "Success" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:158
Result:true
Title:WN10-AU-000084
Description:The system must be configured to audit Object Access - Other Object Access Events successes.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Audit Other Object Access Events' is set to 'Success')
    • true ('Audit Other Object Access Events' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:15800 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
Result:false
Title:'Audit Other Object Access Events' is set to 'Success'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:394100 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:15800 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', other_object_access_events must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
Collected Item Properties:
  • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_account_logon_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • application_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • computer_account_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • distribution_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_account_management_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • security_group_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • user_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • dpapi_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • process_creation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • process_termination equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • rpc_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

  • directory_service_changes equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

  • detailed_directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

  • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Audit Policy Change successes.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220767r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000100
Identities:SV-77969
V-63479
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Audit Policy Change records events related to changes in audit policy. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> "Audit Audit Policy Change" with "Success" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10

  • other_logon_logoff_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • application_generated equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • certification_services equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • detailed_file_share equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
  • file_share equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • filtering_platform_connection equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • filtering_platform_packet_drop equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

  • kernel_object equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

  • registry equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • sam equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

  • sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'

  • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authentication Policy Change successes.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220768r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000105
Identities:V-63481
SV-77971
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9))
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Authentication Policy Change records events related to changes in authentication policy including Kerberos policy and Trust changes. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> "Audit Authentication Policy Change" with "Success" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:3959
Result:true
Title:Audit - Authentication Policy Change - Success
Description:The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authentication Policy Change successes.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Audit Authentication Policy Change' is set to 'Success')
    • false ('Audit Authentication Policy Change' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
Tests:

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220769r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000107
Identities:V-71761
SV-86385
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Authorization Policy Change records events related to changes in user rights, such as Create a token object. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> "Audit Authorization Policy Change" with "Success" selected.

Weight:10.0

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220770r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000110
Identities:V-63483
SV-77973
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9))
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Sensitive Privilege Use records events related to use of sensitive privileges, such as "Act as part of the operating system" or "Debug programs". false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Privilege Use >> "Audit Sensitive Privilege Use" with "Failure" selected.

  • security_state_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

The system must be configured to audit Privilege Use - Sensitive Privilege Use successes.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220771r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000115
Identities:V-63487
SV-77977
CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Sensitive Privilege Use records events related to use of sensitive privileges, such as "Act as part of the operating system" or "Debug programs". false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Privilege Use >> "Audit Sensitive Privilege Use" with "Success" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:3961
Result:true
Title:Audit - Sensitive Privilege Use - Success
Description:The system must be configured to audit Privilege Use - Sensitive Privilege Use successes.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Audit Sensitive Privilege Use' is set to 'Success')
    • true ('Audit Sensitive Privilege Use' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
Tests:

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220772r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000120
Identities:V-63491
SV-77981
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

IPSec Driver records events related to the IPSec Driver such as dropped packets. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit IPSec Driver" with "Failure" selected.

The system must be configured to audit System - Other System Events successes.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220773r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000130
Identities:V-63499
SV-77989
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Audit Other System Events records information related to cryptographic key operations and the Windows Firewall service. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit Other System Events" with "Success" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:

The system must be configured to audit System - Other System Events failures.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220774r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000135
Identities:V-63503
SV-77993
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Audit Other System Events records information related to cryptographic key operations and the Windows Firewall service. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit Other System Events" with "Failure" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220775r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000140
Identities:V-63507
SV-77997
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9))
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Security State Change records events related to changes in the security state, such as startup and shutdown of the system. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit Security State Change" with "Success" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220776r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000150
Identities:SV-78003
V-63513
CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9))
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Security System Extension records events related to extension code being loaded by the security subsystem. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit Security System Extension" with "Success" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:3967
Result:true
Title:Audit - Security System Extension - Success
Description:The system must be configured to audit System - Security System Extension successes.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Audit Security System Extension' is set to 'Success')
    • false ('Audit Security System Extension' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:396700 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
Result:true
Title:'Audit Security System Extension' is set to 'Success'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:394100 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:396700 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', security_system_extension must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
Collected Item Properties:
  • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_account_logon_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • application_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • computer_account_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • distribution_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_account_management_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • security_group_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • user_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • dpapi_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • process_creation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • process_termination equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • rpc_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • directory_service_access equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • directory_service_changes equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • detailed_directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • account_lockout equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
  • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_logon_logoff_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • application_generated equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • certification_services equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • detailed_file_share equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
  • file_share equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • filtering_platform_connection equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • filtering_platform_packet_drop equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • handle_manipulation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • kernel_object equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_object_access_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • registry equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • sam equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • removable_storage equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • central_access_policy_staging equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • audit_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • authentication_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • authorization_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • mpssvc_rule_level_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • other_policy_change_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • non_sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_privilege_use_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • ipsec_driver equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
  • other_system_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'

  • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220777r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000155
Identities:SV-78005
V-63515
CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c)
CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9))
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

System Integrity records events related to violations of integrity to the security subsystem. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit System Integrity" with "Failure" selected.

Weight:10.0

  • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_logon_logoff_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • application_generated equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • certification_services equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • detailed_file_share equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
  • file_share equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • filtering_platform_connection equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • filtering_platform_packet_drop equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • handle_manipulation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • kernel_object equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_object_access_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • registry equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • sam equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • removable_storage equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • central_access_policy_staging equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • audit_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • authentication_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • authorization_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • mpssvc_rule_level_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • other_policy_change_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • non_sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • other_privilege_use_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • ipsec_driver equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
  • other_system_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • security_state_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
  • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

The Application event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220779r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000500
Identities:V-63519
SV-78009
CCI-001849 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4)
Description: Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel. false
Fix Text:If the system is configured to send audit records directly to an audit server, this is NA. This must be documented with the ISSO.

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Event Log Service >> Application >> "Specify the maximum log file size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "32768" or greater.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4054
Result:true
Title:Maximum Log Size - Application
Description:The Application event log must be configured to a minimum size requirement.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Specify the maximum log size (KB)' is set at a minimum to 'Enabled:32768')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:405400 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Specify the maximum log size (KB)' is set at a minimum to 'Enabled:32768'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:405400 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog\Application'
  • name must be equal to 'MaxSize'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:405400 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be greater than or equal to '32768'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog\Application'
  • name equals 'MaxSize'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '32768'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The Security event log size must be configured to 1024000 KB or greater.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220780r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000505
Identities:CCE-50401-9
V-63523
SV-78013
CCI-001849 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4)
Description: Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Event Log Service >> Security >> "Specify the maximum log file size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "1024000" or greater.

If the system is configured to send audit records directly to an audit server, documented with the ISSO.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072

  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Specify the maximum log size (KB)' is set to 'Enabled' with a 'Maximum Log Size' of '1024000' or greater)

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog\Security'
  • name must be equal to 'MaxSize'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:419900 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be greater than or equal to '1024000'

  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog\Security'
  • name equals 'MaxSize'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1024000'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Windows 10 permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220782r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000515
Identities:SV-78023
V-63533
CCI-000163 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9)
CCI-000164 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9)
CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Application event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied. false
Fix Text:Ensure the permissions on the Application event log (Application.evtx) are configured to prevent standard user accounts or groups from having access. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement.

Eventlog - Full Control
SYSTEM - Full Control
Administrators - Full Control

The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\SYSTEM32\WINEVT\LOGS" directory.

If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:51
Result:true
Title:Permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Application event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (The Applicaion event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path)
      • false (The Application event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.) (negated)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (The Applicaion event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path)
      • true (The Application event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:5101 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
Result:true
Title:The Applicaion event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:5103 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
Exclude Items If:
  • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
Exclude Items If:
  • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
Exclude Items If:
  • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
Exclude Items If:
  • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'
Exclude Items If:
  • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-15-2-1'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:5102 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:The Application event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:5102 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\Application'
  • name must be equal to 'file'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:5104 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '^%[Ss][Yy][Ss][Tt][Ee][Mm][Rr][Oo][Oo][Tt]%.*$'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\Application'
  • name equals 'file'
  • last_write_time equals '132628227480000000'
  • type equals 'reg_expand_sz'
  • value equals '%SystemRoot%\system32\winevt\Logs\Application.evtx'
  • expanded_value equals 'C:\Windows\system32\winevt\Logs\Application.evtx'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:5100 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
Result:true
Title:The Applicaion event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path
Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
Check:Result is based on check existence only.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:5100 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
Exclude Items If:
  • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
Exclude Items If:
  • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
Exclude Items If:
  • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
Exclude Items If:
  • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'
Exclude Items If:
  • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-15-2-1'

Windows 10 permissions for the Security event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220783r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000520
Identities:SV-78027
V-63537
CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9)
CCI-000164 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9)
CCI-000163 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Security event log may disclose sensitive information or be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied. false
Fix Text:Ensure the permissions on the Security event log (Security.evtx) are configured to prevent standard user accounts or groups from having access. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement.

Eventlog - Full Control
SYSTEM - Full Control
Administrators - Full Control

The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\SYSTEM32\WINEVT\LOGS" directory.

If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0

Windows 10 permissions for the System event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220784r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000525
Identities:V-63541
SV-78031
CCI-000164 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9)
CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9)
CCI-000163 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The System event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied. false
Fix Text:Ensure the permissions on the System event log (System.evtx) are configured to prevent standard user accounts or groups from having access. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement.

Eventlog - Full Control

Administrators - Full Control

The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\SYSTEM32\WINEVT\LOGS" directory.

If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".

Windows 10 must be configured to audit Other Policy Change Events Successes.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220785r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000550
Identities:SV-108655
V-99551
CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Audit Other Policy Change Events contains events about EFS Data Recovery Agent policy changes, changes in Windows Filtering Platform filter, status on Security policy settings updates for local Group Policy settings, Central Access Policy changes, and detailed troubleshooting events for Cryptographic Next Generation (CNG) operations. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change>> "Audit Other Policy Change Events" with "Success" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:4209
Result:true
Title:Audit - Other Policy Change Events - Success
Description:The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Other Policy Change Events successes.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Audit Other Policy Change Events' is set to 'Success')
    • true ('Audit Other Policy Change Events' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:420900 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
Result:false
Title:'Audit Other Policy Change Events' is set to 'Success'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:394100 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:420900 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', other_policy_change_events must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
Collected Item Properties:
  • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
  • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

Windows 10 must be configured to audit other Logon/Logoff Events Successes.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220787r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000560
Identities:SV-108647
V-99543
CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Audit Other Logon/Logoff Events determines whether Windows generates audit events for other logon or logoff events. Logon events are essential to understanding user activity and detecting potential attacks. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Other Logon/Logoff Events" with "Success" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10

Subject:Windows 10

  • detailed_directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
  • account_lockout equals 'AUDIT_FAILURE'

Windows 10 must be configured to audit other Logon/Logoff Events Failures.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220788r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000565
Identities:SV-108645
V-99541
CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Audit Other Logon/Logoff Events determines whether Windows generates audit events for other logon or logoff events. Logon events are essential to understanding user activity and detecting potential attacks. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Other Logon/Logoff Events" with "Failure" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:4205
Result:true
Title:Audit - Other Logon/Logoff Events - Failure
Description:The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Other Logon/Logoff Events failures.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Audit Other Logon/Logoff Events' is set to 'Failure')
    • true ('Audit Other Logon/Logoff Events' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:420500 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
Result:false
Title:'Audit Other Logon/Logoff Events' is set to 'Failure'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

Object Requirements:
  • Collect any available items.

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', other_logon_logoff_events must be equal to 'AUDIT_FAILURE'

Windows 10 must be configured to audit Detailed File Share Failures.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220789r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000570
Identities:V-99545
SV-108649
CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Audit Detailed File Share allows you to audit attempts to access files and folders on a shared folder.
The Detailed File Share setting logs an event every time a file or folder is accessed, whereas the File Share setting only records one event for any connection established between a client and file share. Detailed File Share audit events include detailed information about the permissions or other criteria used to grant or deny access. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> “Detailed File Share" with "Failure" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:4206
Result:true
Title:Audit - Detailed File Share - Failure
Description:The system must be configured to audit Object Access - Detailed File Share failures.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Audit Detailed File Share' is set to 'Failure')
    • false ('Audit Detailed File Share' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
Tests:

Windows 10 must be configured to audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change Successes.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220790r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000575
Identities:V-99547
SV-108651
CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change determines whether the operating system generates audit events when changes are made to policy rules for the Microsoft Protection Service (MPSSVC.exe). false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> “Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change" with "Success" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10

Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072

Windows 10 must be configured to audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change Failures.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220791r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-AU-000580
Identities:V-99549
SV-108653
CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change determines whether the operating system generates audit events when changes are made to policy rules for the Microsoft Protection Service (MPSSVC.exe). false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> “Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change" with "Failure" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:4208
Result:true
Title:Audit - MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change - Failure
Description:The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change successes.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change' is set to 'Failure')
    • true ('Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
Tests:

The display of slide shows on the lock screen must be disabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220794r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000010
Identities:V-63549
SV-78039
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: Slide shows that are displayed on the lock screen could display sensitive information to unauthorized personnel. Turning off this feature will limit access to the information to a logged on user. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Control Panel >> Personalization >> "Prevent enabling lock screen slide show" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:69
Result:true
Title:The display of slide shows on the lock screen must be disabled.
Description:The display of slide shows on the lock screen must be disabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true (Verifies 'Prevent enabling lock screen slide show' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:6900 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:Verifies 'Prevent enabling lock screen slide show' is set to 'Enabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:6900 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Personalization'
  • name must be equal to 'NoLockScreenSlideshow'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:6900 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Personalization'
  • name equals 'NoLockScreenSlideshow'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252060000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

IPv6 source routing must be configured to highest protection.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220795r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000020
Identities:V-63555
SV-78045
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Configuring the system to disable IPv6 source routing protects against spoofing. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MSS (Legacy) >> "MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting IPv6) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)" to "Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled".

This policy setting requires the installation of the MSS-Legacy custom templates included with the STIG package. "MSS-Legacy.admx" and " MSS-Legacy.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4176
Result:true
Title:IPv6 Source Routing
Description:IPv6 source routing must be configured to the highest protection level.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting IPv6) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)' is set to 'Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:417600 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting IPv6) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)' is set to 'Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:417600 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip6\Parameters'
  • name must be equal to 'DisableIPSourceRouting'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:417600 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '2'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip6\Parameters'
  • name equals 'DisableIPSourceRouting'
  • last_write_time equals '132629232850000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '2'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The system must be configured to prevent IP source routing.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220796r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000025
Identities:V-63559
SV-78049

Description: Configuring the system to disable IP source routing protects against spoofing. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MSS (Legacy) >> "MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)" to "Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled".

This policy setting requires the installation of the MSS-Legacy custom templates included with the STIG package. "MSS-Legacy.admx" and " MSS-Legacy.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.

The system must be configured to prevent Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects from overriding Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) generated routes.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220797r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000030
Identities:SV-78053
V-63563
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Allowing ICMP redirect of routes can lead to traffic not being routed properly. When disabled, this forces ICMP to be routed via shortest path first. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MSS (Legacy) >> "MSS: (EnableICMPRedirect) Allow ICMP redirects to override OSPF generated routes" to "Disabled".

This policy setting requires the installation of the MSS-Legacy custom templates included with the STIG package. "MSS-Legacy.admx" and " MSS-Legacy.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
Severity:low
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4178
Result:true
Title:Disable ICMP Redirect
Description:The system must be configured to prevent ICMP redirects from overriding OSPF generated routes.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('MSS: (EnableICMPRedirect) Allow ICMP redirects to override OSPF generated routes' is set to 'Disabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:417800 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'MSS: (EnableICMPRedirect) Allow ICMP redirects to override OSPF generated routes' is set to 'Disabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:417800 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters'
  • name must be equal to 'EnableICMPRedirect'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:417800 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip\Parameters'
  • name equals 'EnableICMPRedirect'
  • last_write_time equals '132629232850000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The system must be configured to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220798r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000035
Identities:SV-78057
V-63567
CCI-002385 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-5)
Description: Configuring the system to ignore name release requests, except from WINS servers, prevents a denial of service (DoS) attack. The DoS consists of sending a NetBIOS name release request to the server for each entry in the server's cache, causing a response delay in the normal operation of the servers WINS resolution capability. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MSS (Legacy) >> "MSS: (NoNameReleaseOnDemand) Allow the computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers" to "Enabled".

This policy setting requires the installation of the MSS-Legacy custom templates included with the STIG package. "MSS-Legacy.admx" and " MSS-Legacy.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
Severity:low
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4182
Result:true
Title:Name-Release Attacks
Description:The system must be configured to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('MSS: (NoNameReleaseOnDemand) Allow computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:418200 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'MSS: (NoNameReleaseOnDemand) Allow computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers' is set to 'Enabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:418200 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Netbt\Parameters'
  • name must be equal to 'NoNameReleaseOnDemand'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:418200 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Netbt\Parameters'
  • name equals 'NoNameReleaseOnDemand'
  • last_write_time equals '132629232850000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Local administrator accounts must have their privileged token filtered to prevent elevated privileges from being used over the network on domain systems.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220799r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000037
Identities:V-63597
SV-78087
CCI-001084 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-3.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-3)
Description: A compromised local administrator account can provide means for an attacker to move laterally between domain systems.

With User Account Control enabled, filtering the privileged token for built-in administrator accounts will prevent the elevated privileges of these accounts from being used over the network. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Apply UAC restrictions to local accounts on network logons" to "Enabled".

This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:17
Result:true
Title:Local administrator accounts must have their privileged token filtered to prevent elevated privileges from being used over the network on domain systems.
Description:Local administrator accounts must have their privileged token filtered to prevent elevated privileges from being used over the network on domain systems.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true (Local admin accounts filtered token policy is enabled on domain systems)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (DomainRole is 0 or 2)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:413900 (registry_test)
Result:true

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:413900 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System'
  • name must be equal to 'LocalAccountTokenFilterPolicy'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:397100 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System'
  • name equals 'LocalAccountTokenFilterPolicy'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:8200 (wmi_test)
Result:true
Title:DomainRole is 0 or 2
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:8200 (wmi_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT DomainRole FROM Win32_ComputerSystem'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:8200 (wmi_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', result must be equal to '0'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:8201 (wmi_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', result must be equal to '2'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT DomainRole FROM Win32_ComputerSystem'
  • result equals '0'

WDigest Authentication must be disabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220800r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000038
Identities:V-71763
SV-86387
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: When the WDigest Authentication protocol is enabled, plain text passwords are stored in the Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) exposing them to theft. WDigest is disabled by default in Windows 10. This setting ensures this is enforced. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "WDigest Authentication (disabling may require KB2871997)" to "Disabled".

The patch referenced in the policy title is not required for Windows 10.

This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:148
Result:true
Title:WDigest Authentication must be disabled
Description:WDigest Authentication must be disabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true (WDigest Authentication is disabled)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:14800 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:WDigest Authentication is disabled
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:14800 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\Wdigest'
  • name must be equal to 'UseLogonCredential'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:14800 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\Wdigest'
  • name equals 'UseLogonCredential'
  • last_write_time equals '132629232850000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Run as different user must be removed from context menus.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220801r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000039
Identities:V-72329
SV-86953
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: The "Run as different user" selection from context menus allows the use of credentials other than the currently logged on user. Using privileged credentials in a standard user session can expose those credentials to theft. Removing this option from context menus helps prevent this from occurring. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Remove "Run as Different User" from context menus" to "Enabled".

This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0

Subject:Windows 10

Insecure logons to an SMB server must be disabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220802r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000040
Identities:SV-78059
V-63569
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Insecure guest logons allow unauthenticated access to shared folders. Shared resources on a system must require authentication to establish proper access. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Network >> Lanman Workstation >> "Enable insecure guest logons" to "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:

  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Enable insecure guest logons' is set to 'Disabled')
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (The OS is Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB)
      • false (The OS Build is equal to 10240)

Internet connection sharing must be disabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220803r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000044
Identities:SV-86389
V-71765
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: Internet connection sharing makes it possible for an existing internet connection, such as through wireless, to be shared and used by other systems essentially creating a mobile hotspot. This exposes the system sharing the connection to others with potentially malicious purpose. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Network >> Network Connections >> "Prohibit use of Internet Connection Sharing on your DNS domain network" to "Enabled".

Hardened UNC Paths must be defined to require mutual authentication and integrity for at least the \\*\SYSVOL and \\*\NETLOGON shares.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220804r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000050
Identities:SV-78067
V-63577
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Additional security requirements are applied to Universal Naming Convention (UNC) paths specified in Hardened UNC paths before allowing access them. This aids in preventing tampering with or spoofing of connections to these paths. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Network >> Network Provider >> "Hardened UNC Paths" to "Enabled" with at least the following configured in "Hardened UNC Paths:" (click the "Show" button to display).

Value Name: \\*\SYSVOL
Value: RequireMutualAuthentication=1, RequireIntegrity=1

Value Name: \\*\NETLOGON
Value: RequireMutualAuthentication=1, RequireIntegrity=1
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:19
Result:true
Title:Hardened UNC Paths must be defined to require mutual authentication and integrity for at least the \\*\SYSVOL and \\*\NETLOGON shares.
Description:Hardened UNC Paths must be defined to require mutual authentication and integrity for at least the \\*\SYSVOL and \\*\NETLOGON shares.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (Mutual Authentication and Integrity for \\*\SYSVOL)
      • true (Mutual Authentication and Integrity for \\*\NETLOGON)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (DomainRole is 0 or 2)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:1900 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:Mutual Authentication and Integrity for \\*\SYSVOL
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
State Operator:All item-state comparisons must be true.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:1900 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\NetworkProvider\HardenedPaths'
  • name must be equal to '\\*\SYSVOL'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:1900 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '(^| *, *)RequireMutualAuthentication=1( *, *|$)'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:1901 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '(^|[ *, *])RequireMutualAuthentication=(?!1( *, *|$))'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:1902 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '(^| *, *)RequireIntegrity=1( *, *|$)'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:1903 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '(^| *, *)RequireIntegrity=(?!1( *, *|$))'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\NetworkProvider\HardenedPaths'
  • name equals '\\*\SYSVOL'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252060000000'
  • type equals 'reg_sz'
  • value equals 'RequireMutualAuthentication=1,RequireIntegrity=1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:1901 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:Mutual Authentication and Integrity for \\*\NETLOGON
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
State Operator:All item-state comparisons must be true.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:1901 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\NetworkProvider\HardenedPaths'
  • name must be equal to '\\*\NETLOGON'

State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '(^| *, *)RequireMutualAuthentication=1( *, *|$)'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:1901 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '(^|[ *, *])RequireMutualAuthentication=(?!1( *, *|$))'
