  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '(^| *, *)RequireIntegrity=1( *, *|$)'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '(^| *, *)RequireIntegrity=(?!1( *, *|$))'

  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\NetworkProvider\HardenedPaths'
  • name equals '\\*\NETLOGON'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252060000000'

  • value equals 'RequireMutualAuthentication=1,RequireIntegrity=1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:8200 (wmi_test)
Result:true
Title:DomainRole is 0 or 2
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT DomainRole FROM Win32_ComputerSystem'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', result must be equal to '0'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', result must be equal to '2'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT DomainRole FROM Win32_ComputerSystem'
  • result equals '0'

Simultaneous connections to the Internet or a Windows domain must be limited.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220806r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000055
Identities:SV-78071
V-63581
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Multiple network connections can provide additional attack vectors to a system and must be limited. The "Minimize the number of simultaneous connections to the Internet or a Windows Domain" setting prevents systems from automatically establishing multiple connections. When both wired and wireless connections are available, for example, the less preferred connection (typically wireless) will be disconnected. false
Fix Text:The default behavior for "Minimize the number of simultaneous connections to the Internet or a Windows Domain" is "Enabled".

If this needs to be corrected, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Network >> Windows Connection Manager >> "Minimize the number of simultaneous connections to the Internet or a Windows Domain" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:95
Result:true
Title:WN10-CC-000055
Description:Simultaneous connections to the Internet or a Windows domain must be limited.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Minimize the number of simultaneous connections to the Internet or a Windows Domain' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:9500 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Minimize the number of simultaneous connections to the Internet or a Windows Domain' is set to 'Enabled'
Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:398400 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WcmSvc\GroupPolicy\'
  • name must be equal to 'fMinimizeConnections'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:398400 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'

Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000060
Identities:SV-78075
V-63585
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Multiple network connections can provide additional attack vectors to a system and should be limited. When connected to a domain, communication must go through the domain connection. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Network >> Windows Connection Manager >> "Prohibit connection to non-domain networks when connected to domain authenticated network" to "Enabled".

Wi-Fi Sense must be disabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220808r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000065
Identities:SV-78081
V-63591
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Wi-Fi Sense automatically connects the system to known hotspots and networks that contacts have shared. It also allows the sharing of the system's known networks to contacts. Automatically connecting to hotspots and shared networks can expose a system to unsecured or potentially malicious systems. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Network >> WLAN Service >> WLAN Settings>> "Allow Windows to automatically connect to suggested open hotspots, to networks shared by contacts, and to hotspots offering paid services" to "Disabled".

v1507 LTSB does not include this group policy setting. It may be configured through other means such as using group policy from a later version of Windows 10 or a registry update.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10

Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10

      • true (The OS Build is equal to or greater than 17134.0)
    • true (Verifies 'Allow Windows to automatically connect to suggested open hotspots, to networks shared by contacts, and to hotspots offering paid service' is set to 'Disabled')

Command line data must be included in process creation events.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220809r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000066
Identities:CCE-50128-8
SV-83409
V-68817
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Enabling "Include command line data for process creation events" will record the command line information with the process creation events in the log. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Audit Process Creation >> "Include command line in process creation events" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:139
Result:true

Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Include command line in process creation events' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:

Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\Audit'
  • name must match the pattern 'ProcessCreationIncludeCmdLine_Enabled'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'

  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Windows 10 must be configured to enable Remote host allows delegation of non-exportable credentials.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220810r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000068
Identities:V-74699
SV-89373
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: An exportable version of credentials is provided to remote hosts when using credential delegation which exposes them to theft on the remote host. Restricted Admin mode or Remote Credential Guard allow delegation of non-exportable credentials providing additional protection of the credentials. Enabling this configures the host to support Restricted Admin mode or Remote Credential Guard. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Credentials Delegation >> "Remote host allows delegation of non-exportable credentials" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072

Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (The OS Build is equal to or greater than 15063) (negated)
      • false (The OS is Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB)
    • true ('Remote host allows delegation of non-exportable credentials' is set to 'Enabled')

Early Launch Antimalware, Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy must prevent boot drivers.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220813r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000085
Identities:V-63607
SV-78097
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: By being launched first by the kernel, ELAM ( Early Launch Antimalware) is ensured to be launched before any third-party software, and is therefore able to detect malware in the boot process and prevent it from initializing. false
Fix Text:Ensure that Early Launch Antimalware - Boot-Start Driver Initialization policy is set to enforce "Good, unknown and bad but critical" (preventing "bad").

If this needs to be corrected configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Early Launch Antimalware >> "Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy" to "Enabled” with "Good, unknown and bad but critical" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:97
Result:true
Title:Early Launch Antimalware, Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy must prevent boot drivers identified.
Description:Early Launch Antimalware, Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy must prevent boot drivers.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy' is not set to 'All')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:9700 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy' is not set to 'All'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:At least one collected item must match the given state(s).
State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:9700 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Policies\EarlyLaunch'
  • name must be equal to 'DriverLoadPolicy'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:9700 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '3'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:9701 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:9702 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '8'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Policies\EarlyLaunch'
  • name equals 'DriverLoadPolicy'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252060000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '3'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Group Policy objects must be reprocessed even if they have not changed.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220814r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000090
Identities:V-63609
SV-78099
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Enabling this setting and then selecting the "Process even if the Group Policy objects have not changed" option ensures that the policies will be reprocessed even if none have been changed. This way, any unauthorized changes are forced to match the domain-based group policy settings again. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Group Policy >> "Configure registry policy processing" to "Enabled" and select the option "Process even if the Group Policy objects have not changed".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:98
Result:true
Title:Group Policy objects must be reprocessed even if they have not changed.
Description:Enabling this setting and then selecting the "Process even if the Group Policy objects have not changed" option ensures that the policies will be reprocessed even if none have been changed. This way, any unauthorized changes are forced to match the domain-based group policy settings again.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true (NoGPOistChanges is set to 0.)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:9800 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:NoGPOistChanges is set to 0.
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:399802 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2}'
  • name must be equal to 'NoGPOListChanges'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:9800 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2}'
  • name equals 'NoGPOListChanges'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Downloading print driver packages over HTTP must be prevented.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220815r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000100
Identities:V-63615
SV-78105
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system. This setting prevents the computer from downloading print driver packages over HTTP. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Internet Communication Management >> Internet Communication settings >> "Turn off downloading of print drivers over HTTP" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:

Result:true
Title:HTTP Printer Drivers
Description:Downloading print driver packages over HTTP must be prevented.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Turn off downloading of print drivers over HTTP' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:400200 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Turn off downloading of print drivers over HTTP' is set to 'Enabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:400200 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Printers'
  • name must be equal to 'DisableWebPnPDownload'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:400200 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Printers'
  • name equals 'DisableWebPnPDownload'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252060000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Systems must at least attempt device authentication using certificates.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220818r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000115
Identities:SV-78117
V-63627
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Using certificates to authenticate devices to the domain provides increased security over passwords. By default systems will attempt to authenticate using certificates and fall back to passwords if the domain controller does not support certificates for devices. This may also be configured to always use certificates for device authentication. false
Fix Text:This requirement is applicable to domain-joined systems, for standalone systems this is NA.

The default behavior for "Support device authentication using certificate" is "Automatic".

If this needs to be corrected, configured the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Kerberos >> "Support device authentication using certificate" to "Not Configured or "Enabled" with either option selected in "Device authentication behavior using certificate:".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:21
Result:true
Title:Systems must at least attempt device authentication using certificates.
Description:Systems must at least attempt device authentication using certificates.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true (DevicePKInitEnabled (reg_dword) is 1 or does not exist)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (DomainRole is 0 or 2)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:2100 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:DevicePKInitEnabled (reg_dword) is 1 or does not exist
Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:2100 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\Kerberos\Parameters'
  • name must be equal to 'DevicePKInitEnabled'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:2100 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:8200 (wmi_test)
Result:true
Title:DomainRole is 0 or 2
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:8200 (wmi_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT DomainRole FROM Win32_ComputerSystem'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:8200 (wmi_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', result must be equal to '0'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:8201 (wmi_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', result must be equal to '2'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT DomainRole FROM Win32_ComputerSystem'
  • result equals '0'

Result:Pass

Identities:SV-78141
V-63651

Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Remote Assistance >> "Configure Solicited Remote Assistance" to "Disabled".

Unauthenticated RPC clients must be restricted from connecting to the RPC server.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220824r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000165
Identities:SV-78147
V-63657
CCI-001967 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-3 (1))
Description: Configuring RPC to restrict unauthenticated RPC clients from connecting to the RPC server will prevent anonymous connections. false

Weight:10.0
Reference:

Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:

    • true ('Restrict Unauthenticated RPC clients' is set to 'Enabled' and 'Authenticated')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:403400 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Restrict Unauthenticated RPC clients' is set to 'Enabled' and 'Authenticated'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:403400 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Rpc'
  • name must be equal to 'RestrictRemoteClients'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:403400 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be greater than or equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Rpc'
  • name equals 'RestrictRemoteClients'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252060000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The setting to allow Microsoft accounts to be optional for modern style apps must be enabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220825r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000170
Identities:SV-78149
V-63659
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Control of credentials and the system must be maintained within the enterprise. Enabling this setting allows enterprise credentials to be used with modern style apps that support this, instead of Microsoft accounts. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> App Runtime >> "Allow Microsoft accounts to be optional" to "Enabled".

The Application Compatibility Program Inventory must be prevented from collecting data and sending the information to Microsoft.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220826r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000175
Identities:V-63663
SV-78153
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system. This setting will prevent the Program Inventory from collecting data about a system and sending the information to Microsoft. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Application Compatibility >> "Turn off Inventory Collector" to "Enabled".

Autoplay must be turned off for non-volume devices.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220827r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000180
Identities:SV-78157
V-63667
CCI-001764 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 (2))
Description: Allowing autoplay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. Autoplay begins reading from a drive as soon as you insert media in the drive. As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start. This setting will disable autoplay for non-volume devices (such as Media Transfer Protocol (MTP) devices). false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> AutoPlay Policies >> "Disallow Autoplay for non-volume devices" to "Enabled".

Autoplay must be disabled for all drives.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220829r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000190
Identities:SV-78163
V-63673
CCI-001764 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 (2))
Description: Allowing autoplay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. Autoplay begins reading from a drive as soon as you insert media in the drive. As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start. By default, autoplay is disabled on removable drives, such as the floppy disk drive (but not the CD-ROM drive) and on network drives. If you enable this policy, you can also disable autoplay on all drives. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> AutoPlay Policies >> "Turn off AutoPlay" to "Enabled:All Drives".
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072

    • true ('Turn off AutoPlay' is set to 'Enabled:All Drives')
Tests:

Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:404400 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer'
  • name must be equal to 'NoDriveTypeAutoRun'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:404400 (registry_state)

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '255'

  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer'
  • name equals 'NoDriveTypeAutoRun'

  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '255'

Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000197
Identities:V-71771
SV-86395

Organizations may control the execution of applications through other means such as whitelisting. Administrator accounts must not be enumerated during elevation.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220832r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000200
Identities:V-63679
SV-78169
CCI-001084 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-3.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-3)
Description: Enumeration of administrator accounts when elevating can provide part of the logon information to an unauthorized user. This setting configures the system to always require users to type in a username and password to elevate a running application. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Credential User Interface >> "Enumerate administrator accounts on elevation" to "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4047
Result:true
Title:Enumerate Administrator Accounts on Elevation
Description:The system must require username and password to elevate a running application.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Enumerate administrator accounts on elevation' is set to 'Disabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:404700 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Enumerate administrator accounts on elevation' is set to 'Disabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:404700 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\CredUI'
  • name must be equal to 'EnumerateAdministrators'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:404700 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\CredUI'
  • name equals 'EnumerateAdministrators'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

If Enhanced diagnostic data is enabled it must be limited to the minimum required to support Windows Analytics.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220833r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000204
Identities:SV-96859
V-82145
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Limiting this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise. The "Enhanced" level for telemetry includes additional information beyond "Security" and "Basic" on how Windows and apps are used and advanced reliability data. Windows Analytics can use a "limited enhanced" level to provide information such as health data for devices. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Data Collection and Preview Builds >> "Limit Enhanced diagnostic data to the minimum required by Windows Analytics" to "Enabled" with "Enable Windows Analytics collection" selected in "Options:".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:176
Result:true
Title:WN10-CC-000204
Description:If Enhanced diagnostic data is enabled, it must be limited to the minimum required to support Windows Analytics.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Allow Telemetry' is set to 'Enabled' with '2 - Enhanced' selected in 'Options:')
      • true ('Limit Enhanced diagnostic data to the minimum required for Windows Analytics' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Enable Windows Analytics Collection' selected in 'Options:')
    • false (Windows 10 release id is 1709 or newer) (negated)
    • false ('Allow Telemetry' is set to 'Enabled' with '2 - Enhanced' selected in 'Options:') (negated)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:17501 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Allow Telemetry' is set to 'Enabled' with '2 - Enhanced' selected in 'Options:'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:17500 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DataCollection'
  • name must be equal to 'AllowTelemetry'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:17502 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '2'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DataCollection'
  • name equals 'AllowTelemetry'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '2'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:17600 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Limit Enhanced diagnostic data to the minimum required for Windows Analytics' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Enable Windows Analytics Collection' selected in 'Options:'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:17600 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DataCollection'
  • name must be equal to 'LimitEnhancedDiagnosticDataWindowsAnalytics'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:17600 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DataCollection'
  • name equals 'LimitEnhancedDiagnosticDataWindowsAnalytics'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:17200 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:Windows 10 release id is 1709 or newer
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:17200 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name must be equal to 'ReleaseId'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:17200 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than or equal to '1709'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name equals 'ReleaseId'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252090000000'
  • type equals 'reg_sz'
  • value equals '2009'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Windows Telemetry must not be configured to Full.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220834r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000205
Identities:SV-78173
V-63683
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Limiting this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise. The "Security" option for Telemetry configures the lowest amount of data, effectively none outside of the Malicious Software Removal Tool (MSRT), Defender and telemetry client settings. "Basic" sends basic diagnostic and usage data and may be required to support some Microsoft services. "Enhanced" includes additional information on how Windows and apps are used and advanced reliability data. Windows Analytics can use a "limited enhanced" level to provide information such as health data for devices. This requires the configuration of an additional setting available with v1709 and later of Windows 10. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Data Collection and Preview Builds >> "Allow Telemetry" to "Enabled" with "0 - Security [Enterprise Only]" or "1 - Basic" selected in "Options:".

If an organization is using v1709 or later of Windows 10 this may be configured to "2 - Enhanced" to support Windows Analytics. V-82145 must also be configured to limit the Enhanced diagnostic data to the minimum required by Windows Analytics.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:175
Result:true
Title:WN10-CC-000205
Description:Windows Telemetry must not be configured to Full.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Allow Telemetry' is set to 'Enabled' with '2 - Enhanced' selected in 'Options:')
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Windows 10 release id is 1709 or newer)
    • false ('Allow Telemetry' is set to 'Enabled' with '0 - Security [Enterprise Only]' or '1 - Basic' selected in 'Options:')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:17501 (registry_test)
Result:true

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DataCollection'
  • name must be equal to 'AllowTelemetry'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:17502 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '2'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DataCollection'
  • name equals 'AllowTelemetry'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '2'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:17200 (registry_test)
Result:true

  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DataCollection'
  • name must be equal to 'AllowTelemetry'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'

  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DataCollection'

  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '2'

Windows Update must not obtain updates from other PCs on the Internet.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220835r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000206
Identities:V-65681
SV-80171
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Windows 10 allows Windows Update to obtain updates from additional sources instead of Microsoft. In addition to Microsoft, updates can be obtained from and sent to PCs on the local network as well as on the Internet. This is part of the Windows Update trusted process, however to minimize outside exposure, obtaining updates from or sending to systems on the Internet must be prevented. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Delivery Optimization >> "Download Mode" to "Enabled" with any option except "Internet" selected.

Acceptable selections include:
Bypass (100)
Group (2)
HTTP only (0)
LAN (1)
Simple (99)

v1507 (LTSB) does not include this group policy setting locally. For domain joined systems, configure through domain group policy as "HTTP only (0)" or "Lan (1)". Standalone systems configure using Settings >> Update & Security >> Windows Update >> Advanced Options >> "Choose how updates are delivered" with either "Off" or "PCs on my local network" selected.
Severity:low
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4985
Result:true
Title:Windows Update must not obtain updates from other PCs on the Internet
Description:Windows 10 allows Windows Update to obtain updates from additional sources instead of Microsoft. In addition to Microsoft, updates can be obtained from and sent to PCs on the local network as well as on the Internet. This is part of the Windows Update trusted process, however to minimize outside exposure, obtaining updates from or sending to systems on the Internet must be prevented.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (The OS is Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB)
      • false (The OS Build is equal to or greater than 14393) (negated)
    • true ('DownloadMode' is set to 'Enabled' with 'HTTP only, LAN, Group, Simple or Bypass' selected.)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:10902 (registry_test)
Result:false
Title:The OS is Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:8300 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name must be equal to 'EditionId'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:8301 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to 'EnterpriseS'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name equals 'EditionId'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252090000000'
  • type equals 'reg_sz'
  • value equals 'Enterprise'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:498502 (registry_test)

  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name must be equal to 'CurrentBuildNumber'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than or equal to '14393'

  • name equals 'CurrentBuildNumber'

  • type equals 'reg_sz'
  • value equals '19042'

State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.

  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DeliveryOptimization'
  • name must be equal to 'DODownloadMode'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:498500 (registry_state)

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '99'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '100'

  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DeliveryOptimization'
  • name equals 'DODownloadMode'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '2'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The Windows Defender SmartScreen for Explorer must be enabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220836r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000210
Identities:V-63685
SV-78175
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: Windows Defender SmartScreen helps protect systems from programs downloaded from the internet that may be malicious. Enabling Windows Defender SmartScreen will warn or prevent users from running potentially malicious programs. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> File Explorer >> "Configure Windows Defender SmartScreen" to "Enabled" with "Warn and prevent bypass" selected.

Windows 10 includes duplicate policies for this setting. It can also be configured under Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Defender SmartScreen >> Explorer.

v1607 LTSB:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> File Explorer >> "Configure Windows SmartScreen" to "Enabled". (Selection options are not available.)

v1507 LTSB:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> File Explorer >> "Configure Windows SmartScreen" to "Enabled" with "Require approval from an administrator before running downloaded unknown software" selected.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:99
Result:true
Title:The Windows Defender SmartScreen must be enabled.
Description:Windows SmartScreen helps protect systems from programs downloaded from the internet that may be malicious. Enabling Windows Defender SmartScreen will warn or prevent users from running potentially malicious programs.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (EnableSmartScreen has value of 1.)
      • true (The OS Build is equal to or greater than 15063)
      • true (ShellSmartScreenLevel has value of Block.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (EnableSmartScreen has value of 1.)
      • true (The OS Build is equal to or greater than 14393)
      • false (The OS Build is equal to or greater than 15063) (negated)
      • false (The OS is Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (The OS is Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB)
      • false (EnableSmartScreen has value of 2.)
      • false (The OS Build is equal to or greater than 14393) (negated)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:9900 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:EnableSmartScreen has value of 1.
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:405800 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System'
  • name must be equal to 'EnableSmartScreen'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:9900 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System'
  • name equals 'EnableSmartScreen'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252060000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:9902 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:The OS Build is equal to or greater than 15063
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name must be equal to 'CurrentBuildNumber'

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name must be equal to 'EditionId'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to 'EnterpriseS'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name equals 'EditionId'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252090000000'
  • type equals 'reg_sz'
  • value equals 'Enterprise'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:9901 (registry_test)
Result:false
Title:EnableSmartScreen has value of 2.
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:405800 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System'
  • name must be equal to 'EnableSmartScreen'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:9901 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '2'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System'
  • name equals 'EnableSmartScreen'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252060000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

Explorer Data Execution Prevention must be enabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220837r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000215
Identities:V-63689
SV-78179
CCI-002824 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-16)
Description: Data Execution Prevention (DEP) provides additional protection by performing checks on memory to help prevent malicious code from running. This setting will prevent Data Execution Prevention from being turned off for File Explorer. false
Fix Text:The default behavior is for data execution prevention to be turned on for file explorer.

If this needs to be corrected, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> File Explorer >> "Turn off Data Execution Prevention for Explorer" to "Not Configured" or "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:104
Result:true
Title:Explorer Data Execution Prevention
Description:Explorer Data Execution Prevention must be enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Turn off Data Execution Prevention for Explorer' is set to 'Disabled' or 'Not Configured')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:10400 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Turn off Data Execution Prevention for Explorer' is set to 'Disabled' or 'Not Configured'
Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:405900 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer'
  • name must be equal to 'NoDataExecutionPrevention'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:405900 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '0'

Turning off File Explorer heap termination on corruption must be disabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220838r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000220
Identities:SV-78181
V-63691
CCI-002385 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-5)
Description: Legacy plug-in applications may continue to function when a File Explorer session has become corrupt. Disabling this feature will prevent this. false
Fix Text:The default behavior is for File Explorer heap termination on corruption to be enabled.

If this needs to be corrected, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> File Explorer >> "Turn off heap termination on corruption" to "Not Configured" or "Disabled".

Weight:10.0

File Explorer shell protocol must run in protected mode.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220839r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000225
Identities:SV-78185
V-63695
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: The shell protocol will limit the set of folders applications can open when run in protected mode. Restricting files an application can open, to a limited set of folders, increases the security of Windows. false
Fix Text:The default behavior is for shell protected mode to be turned on for file explorer.

If this needs to be corrected, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> File Explorer >> "Turn off shell protocol protected mode" to "Not Configured" or "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072

Result:true

  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Turn off shell protocol protected mode' is set to 'Disabled' or 'Not Configured')
Tests:

Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.

  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer'
  • name must be equal to 'PreXPSP2ShellProtocolBehavior'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:10100 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'

Users must not be allowed to ignore Windows Defender SmartScreen filter warnings for malicious websites in Microsoft Edge.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220840r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000230
Identities:V-63699
SV-78189
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: The Windows Defender SmartScreen filter in Microsoft Edge provides warning messages and blocks potentially malicious websites and file downloads. If users are allowed to ignore warnings from the Windows Defender SmartScreen filter they could still access malicious websites. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Microsoft Edge >> "Prevent bypassing Windows Defender SmartScreen prompts for sites" to "Enabled".

Windows 10 includes duplicate policies for this setting. It can also be configured under Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Defender SmartScreen >> Microsoft Edge.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:87
Result:true
Title:Users must not be allowed to ignore SmartScreen filter warnings for malicious websites in Microsoft Edge.
Description:Users must not be allowed to ignore SmartScreen filter warnings for malicious websites in Microsoft Edge.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Don't allow SmartScreen Filter warning overrides' is 'Enabled')
    • false (If Windows 10 LTSB is installed, EditionID is 'EnterpriseS')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:8700 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Don't allow SmartScreen Filter warning overrides' is 'Enabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:8700 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\MicrosoftEdge\PhishingFilter'
  • name must be equal to 'PreventOverride'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:8700 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\MicrosoftEdge\PhishingFilter'
  • name equals 'PreventOverride'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:8701 (registry_test)
Result:false
Title:If Windows 10 LTSB is installed, EditionID is 'EnterpriseS'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name must be equal to 'EditionId'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to 'EnterpriseS'

  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'

    • false (All child checks must be true.)

Result:Pass

  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\MicrosoftEdge\PhishingFilter'
  • name must be equal to 'EnabledV9'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:9000 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\MicrosoftEdge\PhishingFilter'
  • name equals 'EnabledV9'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:9001 (registry_test)
Result:false
Title:If Windows 10 LTSB is installed, EditionID is 'EnterpriseS'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:8300 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name must be equal to 'EditionId'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:8301 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to 'EnterpriseS'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name equals 'EditionId'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252090000000'
  • type equals 'reg_sz'
  • value equals 'Enterprise'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

Windows 10 must be configured to disable Windows Game Recording and Broadcasting.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220845r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000252
Identities:SV-89091
V-74417
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: Windows Game Recording and Broadcasting is intended for use with games, however it could potentially record screen shots of other applications and expose sensitive data. Disabling the feature will prevent this from occurring. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Game Recording and Broadcasting >> "Enables or disables Windows Game Recording and Broadcasting" to "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:164
Result:true
Title:WN10-CC-000252
Description:Windows 10 must be configured to disable Windows Game Recording and Broadcasting.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Enables or disables Windows Game Recording and Broadcasting' is set to 'Disabled')
      • true (The OS Build is equal to or greater than 15063)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (The OS Build is equal to or greater than 15063) (negated)
      • false (The OS is Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB)
Tests:

  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\GameDVR'
  • name must be equal to 'AllowGameDVR'

  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\GameDVR'
  • name equals 'AllowGameDVR'

  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Windows 10 must be configured to require a minimum pin length of six characters or greater.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220847r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000260
Identities:V-63721
SV-78211
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Windows allows the use of PINs as well as biometrics for authentication without sending a password to a network or website where it could be compromised. Longer minimum PIN lengths increase the available combinations an attacker would have to attempt. Shorter minimum length significantly reduces the strength. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> PIN Complexity >> "Minimum PIN length" to "6" or greater.

v1607 LTSB:
The policy path is Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Hello for Business >> Pin Complexity.

v1507 LTSB:
The policy path is Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Microsoft Passport for Work >> Pin Complexity.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:27
Result:true
Title:The minimum pin length for Microsoft Passport for Work must be 6 characters or greater.
Description:The minimum pin length for Microsoft Passport for Work must be 6 characters or greater.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true (Verifies 'Minimum PIN length' is set to '6' or greater.)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:2700 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:Verifies 'Minimum PIN length' is set to '6' or greater.
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:2700 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\PassportForWork\PINComplexity'
  • name must be equal to 'MinimumPINLength'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:2700 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than or equal to '6'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\PassportForWork\PINComplexity'
  • name equals 'MinimumPINLength'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '6'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Passwords must not be saved in the Remote Desktop Client.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220848r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000270
Identities:SV-78219
V-63729
CCI-002038 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-11)
Description: Saving passwords in the Remote Desktop Client could allow an unauthorized user to establish a remote desktop session to another system. The system must be configured to prevent users from saving passwords in the Remote Desktop Client. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Remote Desktop Services >> Remote Desktop Connection Client >> "Do not allow passwords to be saved" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:

Result:true

Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Do not allow passwords to be saved' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:406600 (registry_test)
Result:true

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services'
  • name must be equal to 'DisablePasswordSaving'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:406600 (registry_state)

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services'
  • name equals 'DisablePasswordSaving'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252060000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The Remote Desktop Session Host must require secure RPC communications.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220851r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000285
Identities:V-63737
SV-78227
CCI-001453 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (2))
Description: Allowing unsecure RPC communication exposes the system to man in the middle attacks and data disclosure attacks. A man in the middle attack occurs when an intruder captures packets between a client and server and modifies them before allowing the packets to be exchanged. Usually the attacker will modify the information in the packets in an attempt to cause either the client or server to reveal sensitive information. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Remote Desktop Services >> Remote Desktop Session Host >> Security "Require secure RPC communication" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4099
Result:true

Class:compliance

  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Require secure RPC communication' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:409900 (registry_test)
Result:true

Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services'
  • name must be equal to 'fEncryptRPCTraffic'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:398400 (registry_state)

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'

  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services'

  • last_write_time equals '132629252060000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Result:Pass

Basic authentication for RSS feeds over HTTP must not be used.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220854r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000300
Identities:V-63747
SV-78237
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: Basic authentication uses plain text passwords that could be used to compromise a system. false
Fix Text:The default behavior is for the Windows RSS platform to not use Basic authentication over HTTP connections.

If this needs to be corrected, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> RSS Feeds >> "Turn on Basic feed authentication over HTTP" to "Not Configured" or "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:100
Result:true
Title:Basic authentication for RSS feeds over HTTP must not be used.
Description:Basic authentication uses plain text passwords that could be used to compromise a system.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true (AllowBasicAuthInClear reg value set to not 1)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:10000 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:AllowBasicAuthInClear reg value set to not 1
Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
Check:No collected item may match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:478900 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Feeds'
  • name must be equal to 'AllowBasicAuthInClear'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:10000 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'

Indexing of encrypted files must be turned off.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220855r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000305
Identities:SV-78241
V-63751
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: Indexing of encrypted files may expose sensitive data. This setting prevents encrypted files from being indexed. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Search >> "Allow indexing of encrypted files" to "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:

Result:true
Title:Search - Encrypted Files Indexing
Description:Indexing of encrypted files must be turned off.
Class:compliance

  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Allow indexing of encrypted files' is set to 'Disabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:407700 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Allow indexing of encrypted files' is set to 'Disabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:407700 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Windows Search'
  • name must be equal to 'AllowIndexingEncryptedStoresOrItems'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:407700 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '0'

  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Windows Search'
  • name equals 'AllowIndexingEncryptedStoresOrItems'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252060000000'

Users must be prevented from changing installation options.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220856r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000310
Identities:V-63321
SV-77811
CCI-001812 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-11 (2))
Description: Installation options for applications are typically controlled by administrators. This setting prevents users from changing installation options that may bypass security features. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Installer >> "Allow user control over installs" to "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10

    • true ('Enable user control over installs' is set to 'Disabled')

  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer'
  • name must be equal to 'EnableUserControl'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'

  • key equals 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer'

Users must be notified if a web-based program attempts to install software.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220858r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000320
Identities:V-63329
SV-77819
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Web-based programs may attempt to install malicious software on a system. Ensuring users are notified if a web-based program attempts to install software allows them to refuse the installation. false
Fix Text:The default behavior is for Internet Explorer to warn users and select whether to allow or refuse installation when a web-based program attempts to install software on the system.

If this needs to be corrected, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Installer >> "Prevent Internet Explorer security prompt for Windows Installer scripts" to "Not Configured" or "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:113
Result:true
Title:Users must be notified if a web-based program attempts to install software.
Description:Web-based programs may attempt to install malicious software on a system. Ensuring users are notified if a web-based program attempts to install software allows them to refuse the installation.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('SafeForScripting' is set to 'Disabled' or 'Not Configured')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:11300 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'SafeForScripting' is set to 'Disabled' or 'Not Configured'
Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
Check:No collected item may match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:408600 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer'
  • name must be equal to 'SafeForScripting'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:11300 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'

Automatically signing in the last interactive user after a system-initiated restart must be disabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220859r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000325
Identities:SV-77823
V-63333
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Windows can be configured to automatically sign the user back in after a Windows Update restart. Some protections are in place to help ensure this is done in a secure fashion; however, disabling this will prevent the caching of credentials for this purpose and also ensure the user is aware of the restart. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Logon Options >> "Sign-in last interactive user automatically after a system-initiated restart" to "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:

Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072

Result:true

  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true (Verifies 'Sign-in last interactive user automatically after a system-initiated restart' is set to 'Disabled')
Tests:

Result:true

  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System'
  • name must be equal to 'DisableAutomaticRestartSignOn'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:6500 (registry_state)

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'

  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System'
  • name equals 'DisableAutomaticRestartSignOn'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

PowerShell script block logging must be enabled on Windows 10.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220860r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000326
Identities:SV-83411
V-68819
CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1))
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Enabling PowerShell script block logging will record detailed information from the processing of PowerShell commands and scripts. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows PowerShell >> "Turn on PowerShell Script Block Logging" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:137
Result:true
Title:PowerShell Script block logging must be enabled.
Description:PowerShell Script block logging must be enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true (Check if PowerShell Script Block Logging is set to enabled in the registry)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:13700 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:Check if PowerShell Script Block Logging is set to enabled in the registry
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:13700 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\ScriptBlockLogging'
  • name must match the pattern 'EnableScriptBlockLogging'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:13700 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\ScriptBlockLogging'
  • name equals 'EnableScriptBlockLogging'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252060000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not use Digest authentication.

Result:Pass

Identities:V-63341
SV-77831

Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
