Result:true
Title:'Disallow Digest authentication' is set to 'Enabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:409400 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Client'
  • name must be equal to 'AllowDigest'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:397100 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Client'
  • name equals 'AllowDigest'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252060000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The convenience PIN for Windows 10 must be disabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220870r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000370
Identities:SV-108663
V-99559
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: This policy controls whether a domain user can sign in using a convenience PIN to prevent enabling (Password Stuffer). false
Fix Text:Disable the convenience PIN sign-in.

If this needs to be corrected configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Logon >> Set "Turn on convenience PIN sign-in" to "Disabled”.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:

Result:true

Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Turn on convenience PIN sign-in' is 'Disabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:421200 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Turn on convenience PIN sign-in' is 'Disabled'
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:421200 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System'
  • name must be equal to 'AllowDomainPINLogon'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:421200 (registry_state)

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System'
  • name equals 'AllowDomainPINLogon'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252060000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Windows Ink Workspace configured but disallow access above the lock.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220871r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-CC-000385
Identities:SV-108665
V-99561
CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a)
Description: Securing Windows Ink which contains application and features oriented towards pen computing. false
Fix Text:Disable the convenience PIN sign-in.

If this needs to be corrected configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Ink Workspace >> Set " Allow Windows Ink Workspace" to "Enabled” Set Options ‘On, but disallow access above lock”.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:

Subject:Windows 10

  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Windows 10 Kernel (Direct Memory Access) DMA Protection must be enabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220902r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-EP-000310
Identities:SV-108661
V-99557
CCI-001090 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-4.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-4)
Description: Kernel DMA Protection to protect PCs against drive-by Direct Memory Access (DMA) attacks using PCI hot plug devices connected to Thunderbolt™ 3 ports. Drive-by DMA attacks can lead to disclosure of sensitive information residing on a PC, or even injection of malware that allows attackers to bypass the lock screen or control PCs remotely. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Kernel DMA Protection >> "Enumeration policy for external devices incompatible with Kernel DMA Protection" to "Enabled" with "Enumeration Policy" set to "Block All".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:4211
Result:true
Title:WN10-EP-000310
Description:Windows 10 Kernel (Direct Memory Access) DMA Protection must be enabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Enumeration policy for external devices incompatible with Kernel DMA Protection' is 'Enabled' with 'Enumeration Policy' set to 'Block All')
    • false (Windows 10 is v1709 or prior)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:421100 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Enumeration policy for external devices incompatible with Kernel DMA Protection' is 'Enabled' with 'Enumeration Policy' set to 'Block All'
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

  • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Kernel DMA Protection'
  • name must be equal to 'DeviceEnumerationPolicy'

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'

  • key equals 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Kernel DMA Protection'
  • name equals 'DeviceEnumerationPolicy'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Result:false
Title:Windows 10 is v1709 or prior
Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

  • name must be equal to 'ReleaseId'

The DoD Root CA certificates must be installed in the Trusted Root Store.

Result:Fail
Version:WN10-PK-000005
Identities:V-63579
SV-78069

Description: To ensure secure DoD websites and DoD-signed code are properly validated, the system must trust the DoD Root Certificate Authorities (CAs). The DoD root certificates will ensure that the trust chain is established for server certificates issued from the DoD CAs. false
Fix Text:Install the DoD Root CA certificates.
DoD Root CA 2
DoD Root CA 3
DoD Root CA 4
DoD Root CA 5

The DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store on unclassified systems.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220905r569314_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-PK-000015
Identities:V-63587
SV-78077
CCI-000185 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (2) (a))
CCI-002470 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-23 (5))
Description: To ensure users do not experience denial of service when performing certificate-based authentication to DoD websites due to the system chaining to a root other than DoD Root CAs, the DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificate Store. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems. false
Fix Text:Install the DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates on unclassified systems.

Issued To - Issued By - Thumbprint
DoD Root CA 2 - DoD Interoperability Root CA 1 - A8C27332CCB4CA49554CE55D34062A7DD2850C02
DoD Root CA 3 - DoD Interoperability Root CA 2 - AC06108CA348CC03B53795C64BF84403C1DBD341

The certificates can be installed using the InstallRoot tool. The tool and user guide are available on Cyber Exchange at https://cyber.mil/pki-pke/tools-configuration-files.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:134
Result:false
Title:WN10-PK-000015
Description:The DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store on unclassified systems.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false (DoD Interoperability Root CA 1 certificate expiring 8/26/2022 is installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store)
    • false (DoD Interoperability Root CA 2 certificate expiring 1/22/2022 is installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store)
Tests:

Check:Result is based on check existence only.

The built-in administrator account must be disabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220908r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000005
Identities:CCE-43470-4
SV-78091
V-63601
CCI-000764 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-2; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-2.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2)
Description: The built-in administrator account is a well-known account subject to attack. It also provides no accountability to individual administrators on a system. It must be disabled to prevent its use. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Accounts: Administrator account status" to "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:129
Result:true
Title:Built-in Admin Account Status
Description:The built-in administrator account must be disabled.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Accounts: Administrator account status' is set to 'Disabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:12900 (user_sid55_test)
Result:true
Title:'Accounts: Administrator account status' is set to 'Disabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:At least one collected item must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:12900 (user_sid55_object)
Object Requirements:
  • for user_sid, the following must be true:
    • user_sid must be equal to 'S-1-5-21-3468862342-387163032-2139410191-500'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:12900 (user_sid55_state)
State Requirements:
  • for check = 'all', enabled, the following must be true:
    • enabled must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • user_sid equals 'S-1-5-21-3468862342-387163032-2139410191-500'
  • enabled equals 'false'
  • group_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
  • group_sid equals 'S-1-5-21-3468862342-387163032-2139410191-513'
  • last_logon equals '1605771872'

The built-in guest account must be disabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220909r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000010
Identities:CCE-41528-1
SV-78101
V-63611
CCI-000804 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-8; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-8.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-8)
Description: A system faces an increased vulnerability threat if the built-in guest account is not disabled. This account is a known account that exists on all Windows systems and cannot be deleted. This account is initialized during the installation of the operating system with no password assigned. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Accounts: Guest account status" to "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072

Result:true

    • true ('Accounts: Guest account status' is set to 'Disabled')

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

  • for user_sid, the following must be true:
    • user_sid must be equal to 'S-1-5-21-3468862342-387163032-2139410191-501'

  • for check = 'all', enabled, the following must be true:
    • enabled must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • user_sid equals 'S-1-5-21-3468862342-387163032-2139410191-501'
  • enabled equals 'false'
  • group_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-546'
  • group_sid equals 'S-1-5-21-3468862342-387163032-2139410191-513'
  • last_logon equals '0'

Local accounts with blank passwords must be restricted to prevent access from the network.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220910r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000015
Identities:SV-78107
V-63617
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: An account without a password can allow unauthorized access to a system as only the username would be required. Password policies should prevent accounts with blank passwords from existing on a system. However, if a local account with a blank password did exist, enabling this setting will prevent network access, limiting the account to local console logon only. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4143
Result:true
Title:Limit Blank Passwords
Description:Local accounts with blank passwords must be restricted to prevent access from the network.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:414300 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only' is set to 'Enabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:414300 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\Currentcontrolset\Control\Lsa'
  • name must be equal to 'Limitblankpassworduse'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:414300 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\Currentcontrolset\Control\Lsa'
  • name equals 'Limitblankpassworduse'
  • last_write_time equals '132629235490000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The built-in administrator account must be renamed.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220911r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-SO-000020
Identities:CCE-42970-4
V-63619
SV-78109
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: The built-in administrator account is a well-known account subject to attack. Renaming this account to an unidentified name improves the protection of this account and the system. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Accounts: Rename administrator account" to a name other than "Administrator".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:131
Result:false
Title:Rename Built-in Administrator Account
Description:The built-in administrator account must be renamed.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Accounts: Rename administrator account' is not set to 'Administrator')
    • true ('Accounts: Rename administrator account' is not set to 'localdomain\Administrator')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:13100 (sid_sid_test)
Result:false
Title:'Accounts: Rename administrator account' is not set to 'Administrator'
Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:13101 (sid_sid_object)
Object Requirements:
  • for trustee_sid, the following must be true:
    • trustee_sid must be equal to 'S-1-5-21-3468862342-387163032-2139410191-500'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:13100 (sid_sid_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', trustee_name must not be equal (case insensitive) to 'Administrator'
Collected Item Properties:
  • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-21-3468862342-387163032-2139410191-500'
  • trustee_name equals 'Administrator'
  • trustee_domain equals 'DESKTOP-PSAIUU6'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:13101 (sid_sid_test)
Result:true
Title:'Accounts: Rename administrator account' is not set to 'localdomain\Administrator'
Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:13101 (sid_sid_object)
Object Requirements:
  • for trustee_sid, the following must be true:
    • trustee_sid must be equal to 'S-1-5-21-3468862342-387163032-2139410191-500'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:13101 (sid_sid_state)
State Requirements:
  • for check = 'all', trustee_name, the following must be true:
    • trustee_name must not be equal (case insensitive) to 'DESKTOP-PSAIUU6\Administrator'
Collected Item Properties:
  • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-21-3468862342-387163032-2139410191-500'
  • trustee_name equals 'Administrator'
  • trustee_domain equals 'DESKTOP-PSAIUU6'

The built-in guest account must be renamed.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220912r569187_rule
Result:Fail

Identities:CCE-43078-5
V-63625

Description: The built-in guest account is a well-known user account on all Windows systems and, as initially installed, does not require a password. This can allow access to system resources by unauthorized users. Renaming this account to an unidentified name improves the protection of this account and the system. false

Audit policy using subcategories must be enabled.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220913r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-SO-000030
Identities:SV-78125
V-63635
CCI-000169 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 a)
Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior. This setting allows administrators to enable more precise auditing capabilities. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072

Result:false

  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:414800 (registry_test)
Result:false
Title:'Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings' is set to 'Enabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:414800 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\Currentcontrolset\Control\Lsa'
  • name must be equal to 'scenoapplylegacyauditpolicy'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:414800 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '1'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

Outgoing secure channel traffic must be encrypted or signed.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220914r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000035
Identities:V-63639
SV-78129
CCI-002418 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8)
CCI-002421 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8 (1))
Description: Requests sent on the secure channel are authenticated, and sensitive information (such as passwords) is encrypted, but not all information is encrypted. If this policy is enabled, outgoing secure channel traffic will be encrypted and signed. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4151
Result:true
Title:Encrypting and Signing of Secure Channel Traffic
Description:Outgoing secure channel traffic must be encrypted or signed.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:415100 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)' is set to 'Enabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:415100 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Netlogon\Parameters'
  • name must be equal to 'RequireSignOrSeal'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:415100 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Netlogon\Parameters'
  • name equals 'RequireSignOrSeal'
  • last_write_time equals '132201837070000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Outgoing secure channel traffic must be encrypted when possible.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220915r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000040
Identities:V-63643
SV-78133
CCI-002421 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8 (1))
CCI-002418 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8)
Description: Requests sent on the secure channel are authenticated, and sensitive information (such as passwords) is encrypted, but not all information is encrypted. If this policy is enabled, outgoing secure channel traffic will be encrypted. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible)" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072

    • true ('Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible)' is set to 'Enabled')
    • true ('Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)' is set to 'Enabled')

  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Netlogon\Parameters'
  • name must be equal to 'SealSecureChannel'

    • value must be equal to '1'

  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'

  • name must be equal to 'RequireSignOrSeal'

Outgoing secure channel traffic must be signed when possible.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220916r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000045
Identities:V-63647
SV-78137

CCI-002418 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8)
Description: Requests sent on the secure channel are authenticated, and sensitive information (such as passwords) is encrypted, but the channel is not integrity checked. If this policy is enabled, outgoing secure channel traffic will be signed. false

  • value equals '1'

The computer account password must not be prevented from being reset.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220917r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000050
Identities:V-63653
SV-78143
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Computer account passwords are changed automatically on a regular basis. Disabling automatic password changes can make the system more vulnerable to malicious access. Frequent password changes can be a significant safeguard for your system. A new password for the computer account will be generated every 30 days. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Domain member: Disable machine account password changes" to "Disabled".
Severity:low
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4154
Result:true
Title:Computer Account Password Reset
Description:The computer account password must not be prevented from being reset.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Domain member: Disable machine account password changes' is set to 'Disabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:415400 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Domain member: Disable machine account password changes' is set to 'Disabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:415400 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Netlogon\Parameters'
  • name must be equal to 'DisablePasswordChange'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:415400 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Netlogon\Parameters'
  • name equals 'DisablePasswordChange'
  • last_write_time equals '132201837070000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The maximum age for machine account passwords must be configured to 30 days or less.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220918r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000055
Identities:SV-78151
V-63661
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Computer account passwords are changed automatically on a regular basis. This setting controls the maximum password age that a machine account may have. This setting must be set to no more than 30 days, ensuring the machine changes its password monthly. false
Fix Text:This is the default configuration for this setting (30 days).

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Domain member: Maximum machine account password age" to "30" or less (excluding 0 which is unacceptable).
Severity:low
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4155
Result:true
Title:Maximum Machine Account Password Age
Description:The maximum age for machine account passwords must be set to requirements.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Domain member: Maximum machine account password age' is set to '30' days or less)
    • true ('Domain member: Maximum machine account password age' is not set to '0')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:415500 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Domain member: Maximum machine account password age' is set to '30' days or less
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:415500 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Netlogon\Parameters'
  • name must be equal to 'MaximumPasswordAge'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:415500 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be less than or equal to '30'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Netlogon\Parameters'
  • name equals 'MaximumPasswordAge'
  • last_write_time equals '132201837070000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '30'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:415501 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Domain member: Maximum machine account password age' is not set to '0'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:415500 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Netlogon\Parameters'
  • name must be equal to 'MaximumPasswordAge'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:407101 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Netlogon\Parameters'
  • name equals 'MaximumPasswordAge'
  • last_write_time equals '132201837070000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '30'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The system must be configured to require a strong session key.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220919r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000060
Identities:SV-78155
V-63665
CCI-002418 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8)
CCI-002421 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8 (1))
Description: A computer connecting to a domain controller will establish a secure channel. Requiring strong session keys enforces 128-bit encryption between systems. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Domain member: Require strong (Windows 2000 or Later) session key" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0

    • true ('Domain member: Require strong (Windows 2000 or later) session key' is set to 'Enabled')

The machine inactivity limit must be set to 15 minutes, locking the system with the screensaver.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220920r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-SO-000070
Identities:CCE-47830-5
V-63669
SV-78159
CCI-000057 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 a)
Description: Unattended systems are susceptible to unauthorized use and should be locked when unattended. The screen saver should be set at a maximum of 15 minutes and be password protected. This protects critical and sensitive data from exposure to unauthorized personnel with physical access to the computer. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Interactive logon: Machine inactivity limit" to "900" seconds" or less, excluding "0" which is effectively disabled.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0

Subject:Windows 10

  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than '0'

Caching of logon credentials must be limited.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220923r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000085
Identities:SV-78177
V-63687
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: The default Windows configuration caches the last logon credentials for users who log on interactively to a system. This feature is provided for system availability reasons, such as the user's machine being disconnected from the network or domain controllers being unavailable. Even though the credential cache is well-protected, if a system is attacked, an unauthorized individual may isolate the password to a domain user account using a password-cracking program and gain access to the domain. false
Fix Text:This is the default configuration for this setting (10 logons to cache).

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Interactive logon: Number of previous logons to cache (in case domain controller is not available)" to "10" logons or less.

This setting only applies to domain-joined systems, however, it is configured by default on all systems.
Severity:low
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:114
Result:true
Title:Caching of logon credentials must be limited.
Description:The default Windows configuration caches the last logon credentials for users who log on interactively to a system. This feature is provided for system availability reasons, such as the user's machine being disconnected from the network or domain controllers being unavailable. Even though the credential cache is well-protected, if a system is attacked, an unauthorized individual may isolate the password to a domain user account using a password-cracking program and gain access to the domain.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Interactive logon: Number of previous logons to cache' is set to 10 or less)
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (DomainRole is 0 or 2)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:11400 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Interactive logon: Number of previous logons to cache' is set to 10 or less
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:478500 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon'
  • name must be equal to 'CachedLogonsCount'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:11400 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be less than or equal to '10'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon'
  • name equals 'CachedLogonsCount'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_sz'
  • value equals '10'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:8200 (wmi_test)
Result:true
Title:DomainRole is 0 or 2
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:8200 (wmi_object)
Object Requirements:
  • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
  • wql must be equal to 'SELECT DomainRole FROM Win32_ComputerSystem'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:8200 (wmi_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', result must be equal to '0'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:8201 (wmi_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', result must be equal to '2'
Collected Item Properties:
  • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
  • wql equals 'SELECT DomainRole FROM Win32_ComputerSystem'
  • result equals '0'

The Smart Card removal option must be configured to Force Logoff or Lock Workstation.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220924r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-SO-000095
Identities:V-63697
SV-78187

Description: Unattended systems are susceptible to unauthorized use and must be locked. Configuring a system to lock when a smart card is removed will ensure the system is inaccessible when unattended. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior" to "Lock Workstation" or "Force Logoff".

The Windows SMB client must be configured to always perform SMB packet signing.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220925r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-SO-000100
Identities:V-63703
SV-78193
CCI-002421 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8 (1))
CCI-002418 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8)
Description: The server message block (SMB) protocol provides the basis for many network operations. Digitally signed SMB packets aid in preventing man-in-the-middle attacks. If this policy is enabled, the SMB client will only communicate with an SMB server that performs SMB packet signing. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (always)" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4167
Result:false
Title:SMB Client Packet Signing (Always)
Description:The Windows SMB client must be configured to always perform SMB packet signing.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Microsoft Network Client: Digitally sign communications (always)' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:416700 (registry_test)
Result:false
Title:'Microsoft Network Client: Digitally sign communications (always)' is set to 'Enabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:416700 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanWorkstation\Parameters'
  • name must be equal to 'RequireSecuritySignature'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:416700 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanWorkstation\Parameters'
  • name equals 'RequireSecuritySignature'
  • last_write_time equals '132201837070000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

Unencrypted passwords must not be sent to third-party SMB Servers.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220926r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000110
Identities:V-63711
SV-78201
CCI-000197 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (c); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (c))
Description: Some non-Microsoft SMB servers only support unencrypted (plain text) password authentication. Sending plain text passwords across the network, when authenticating to an SMB server, reduces the overall security of the environment. Check with the vendor of the SMB server to see if there is a way to support encrypted password authentication. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Microsoft network client: Send unencrypted password to third-party SMB servers" to "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4169
Result:true
Title:Unencrypted Password is Sent to SMB Server
Description:Unencrypted passwords must not be sent to a third-party SMB Server.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Microsoft Network Client: Send unencrypted password to connect to third-party SMB servers' is set to 'Disabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:416900 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Microsoft Network Client: Send unencrypted password to connect to third-party SMB servers' is set to 'Disabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:416900 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanWorkstation\Parameters'
  • name must be equal to 'EnablePlainTextPassword'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:416900 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanWorkstation\Parameters'
  • name equals 'EnablePlainTextPassword'
  • last_write_time equals '132201837070000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The Windows SMB server must be configured to always perform SMB packet signing.

Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts must not be allowed.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220929r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000145
Identities:SV-78235
V-63745
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts allows anonymous log on users (null session connections) to list all accounts names, thus providing a list of potential points to attack the system. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts" to "Enabled".
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4190
Result:true
Title:Restrict Anonymous SAM Enumeration
Description:Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts must not be allowed.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:419000 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts' is set to 'Enabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:419000 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
  • name must be equal to 'RestrictAnonymousSAM'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:419000 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
  • name equals 'RestrictAnonymousSAM'
  • last_write_time equals '132629235490000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Anonymous enumeration of shares must be restricted.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220930r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-SO-000150
Identities:SV-78239
V-63749
CCI-001090 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-4.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-4)
Description: Allowing anonymous logon users (null session connections) to list all account names and enumerate all shared resources can provide a map of potential points to attack the system. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts and shares" to "Enabled".
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4191
Result:false

Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts and shares' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:419100 (registry_test)
Result:false
Title:'Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts and shares' is set to 'Enabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:419100 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
  • name must be equal to 'RestrictAnonymous'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:419100 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
  • name equals 'RestrictAnonymous'
  • last_write_time equals '132629235490000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

The system must be configured to prevent anonymous users from having the same rights as the Everyone group.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220931r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000160
Identities:SV-78245
V-63755
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Access by anonymous users must be restricted. If this setting is enabled, then anonymous users have the same rights and permissions as the built-in Everyone group. Anonymous users must not have these permissions or rights. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users" to "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4193
Result:true
Title:Everyone Anonymous Rights
Description:The system must not be configured to give anonymous users Everyone rights.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users' is set to 'Disabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:419300 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users' is set to 'Disabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:419300 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
  • name must be equal to 'EveryoneIncludesAnonymous'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:419300 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
  • name equals 'EveryoneIncludesAnonymous'
  • last_write_time equals '132629235490000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

Anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares must be restricted.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220932r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000165
Identities:V-63759
SV-78249
CCI-001090 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-4.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-4)
Description: Allowing anonymous access to named pipes or shares provides the potential for unauthorized system access. This setting restricts access to those defined in "Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously" and "Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously", both of which must be blank under other requirements. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network access: Restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares" to "Enabled".

Remote calls to the Security Account Manager (SAM) must be restricted to Administrators.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220933r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-SO-000167
Identities:V-71769
SV-86393
CCI-002235 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (10))
Description: The Windows Security Account Manager (SAM) stores users' passwords. Restricting remote rpc connections to the SAM to Administrators helps protect those credentials. false
Fix Text:Navigate to the policy Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network access: Restrict clients allowed to make remote calls to SAM".

Select "Edit Security" to configure the "Security descriptor:".

Add "Administrators" in "Group or user names:" if it is not already listed (this is the default).

Select "Administrators" in "Group or user names:".

Select "Allow" for "Remote Access" in "Permissions for "Administrators".

Click "OK".

The "Security descriptor:" must be populated with "O:BAG:BAD:(A;;RC;;;BA) for the policy to be enforced.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:152
Result:false
Title:Security Account Manager (SAM) RPC
Description:Remote calls to the Security Account Manager (SAM) must be restricted to Administrators.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (The OS is Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB)
      • false (The OS Build is equal to or greater than 14393) (negated)
    • false (Allow Administrators group to make remote calls to SAM)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:10902 (registry_test)
Result:false
Title:The OS is Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:8300 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name must be equal to 'EditionId'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:8301 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to 'EnterpriseS'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name equals 'EditionId'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252090000000'
  • type equals 'reg_sz'
  • value equals 'Enterprise'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:498502 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:The OS Build is equal to or greater than 14393
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:498501 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name must be equal to 'CurrentBuildNumber'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:498505 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than or equal to '14393'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
  • name equals 'CurrentBuildNumber'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252090000000'
  • type equals 'reg_sz'
  • value equals '19042'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:15200 (registry_test)
Result:false
Title:Allow Administrators group to make remote calls to SAM
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:15200 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
  • name must be equal to 'RestrictRemoteSAM'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:15200 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to 'O:BAG:BAD:(A;;RC;;;BA)'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

NTLM must be prevented from falling back to a Null session.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220934r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-SO-000180
Identities:SV-78255
V-63765
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: NTLM sessions that are allowed to fall back to Null (unauthenticated) sessions may gain unauthorized access. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network security: Allow LocalSystem NULL session fallback" to "Disabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:

PKU2U authentication using online identities must be prevented.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220935r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-SO-000185
Identities:V-63767
SV-78257
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: PKU2U is a peer-to-peer authentication protocol. This setting prevents online identities from authenticating to domain-joined systems. Authentication will be centrally managed with Windows user accounts. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities" to "Disabled".

Kerberos encryption types must be configured to prevent the use of DES and RC4 encryption suites.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220936r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-SO-000190
Identities:V-63795
SV-78285
CCI-000803 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-7; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-7.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-7)
Description: Certain encryption types are no longer considered secure. This setting configures a minimum encryption type for Kerberos, preventing the use of the DES and RC4 encryption suites. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos" to "Enabled" with only the following selected:

AES128_HMAC_SHA1
AES256_HMAC_SHA1
Future encryption types
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4203
Result:false
Title:Kerberos Encryption Types
Description:Kerberos encryption types must be configured to prevent the use of DES and RC4 encryption suites.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Network Security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos' is set to 'Enabled' with 'RC4_HMAC_MD5', 'AES128_HMAC_SHA1', 'AES256_HMAC_SHA1', 'Future encryption types')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:420300 (registry_test)
Result:false
Title:'Network Security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos' is set to 'Enabled' with 'RC4_HMAC_MD5', 'AES128_HMAC_SHA1', 'AES256_HMAC_SHA1', 'Future encryption types'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:420300 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\Kerberos\Parameters'
  • name must be equal to 'SupportedEncryptionTypes'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:420300 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '2147483640'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The system must be configured to prevent the storage of the LAN Manager hash of passwords.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220937r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000195
Identities:V-63797
SV-78287
CCI-000196 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (c); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (c))
Description: The LAN Manager hash uses a weak encryption algorithm and there are several tools available that use this hash to retrieve account passwords. This setting controls whether or not a LAN Manager hash of the password is stored in the SAM the next time the password is changed. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change" to "Enabled".
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4204
Result:true
Title:LAN Manager Hash Value Stored
Description:The system must be configured to prevent the storage of the LAN Manager hash of passwords.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:420400 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change' is set to 'Enabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:420400 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
  • name must be equal to 'NoLMHash'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:420400 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
  • name equals 'NoLMHash'
  • last_write_time equals '132629235490000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The LanMan authentication level must be set to send NTLMv2 response only, and to refuse LM and NTLM.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220938r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-SO-000205
Identities:V-63801
SV-78291
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: The Kerberos v5 authentication protocol is the default for authentication of users who are logging on to domain accounts. NTLM, which is less secure, is retained in later Windows versions for compatibility with clients and servers that are running earlier versions of Windows or applications that still use it. It is also used to authenticate logons to stand-alone computers that are running later versions. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network security: LAN Manager authentication level" to "Send NTLMv2 response only. Refuse LM & NTLM".
Severity:high
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4206
Result:false
Title:LanMan Authentication Level
Description:The LanMan authentication level must be set to send NTLMv2 response only, and to refuse LM and NTLM.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Network security: LAN Manager authentication level' is set to 'Send NTLMv2 response only. Refuse LM & NTLM' (Level 5))
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:420600 (registry_test)
Result:false
Title:'Network security: LAN Manager authentication level' is set to 'Send NTLMv2 response only. Refuse LM & NTLM' (Level 5)
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:420600 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
  • name must be equal to 'LmCompatibilityLevel'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:420600 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '5'
Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

The system must be configured to the required LDAP client signing level.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220939r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000210
Identities:SV-78293
V-63803
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: This setting controls the signing requirements for LDAP clients. This setting must be set to Negotiate signing or Require signing, depending on the environment and type of LDAP server in use. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network security: LDAP client signing requirements" to "Negotiate signing" at a minimum.
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:

Result:true
Title:LDAP Client Signing
Description:Network Security: LDAP client signing requirements
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('Network security: LDAP client signing requirements' is set to at a minimum 'Negotiate signing')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:420700 (registry_test)
Result:true

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:420700 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LDAP'
  • name must be equal to 'LDAPClientIntegrity'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:420700 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be greater than or equal to '1'

  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LDAP'
  • name equals 'LDAPClientIntegrity'
  • last_write_time equals '132201837070000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The system must be configured to meet the minimum session security requirement for NTLM SSP based clients.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220940r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-SO-000215
Identities:SV-78295
V-63805
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Microsoft has implemented a variety of security support providers for use with RPC sessions. All of the options must be enabled to ensure the maximum security level. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients" to "Require NTLMv2 session security" and "Require 128-bit encryption" (all options selected).
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:

Result:false

Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false ('Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients' is set to 'Require NTLMv2 session security')
    • true ('Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients' is set to 'Require 128-bit encryption')

Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa\MSV1_0'
  • name must be equal to 'NTLMMinClientSec'

  • name equals 'NTLMMinClientSec'

  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '536870912'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

The system must be configured to use FIPS-compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing, and signing.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220942r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-SO-000230
Identities:SV-78301
V-63811
CCI-002450 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-13)
Description: This setting ensures that the system uses algorithms that are FIPS-compliant for encryption, hashing, and signing. FIPS-compliant algorithms meet specific standards established by the U.S. Government and must be the algorithms used for all OS encryption functions. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "System cryptography: Use FIPS compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing, and signing" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4213
Result:false

Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false ('System cryptography: Use FIPS compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing, and signing' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:421300 (registry_test)
Result:false

Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:421300 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa\FIPSAlgorithmPolicy'
  • name must be equal to 'Enabled'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:421300 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa\FIPSAlgorithmPolicy'
  • name equals 'Enabled'
  • last_write_time equals '132201837080000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '0'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

The default permissions of global system objects must be increased.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220943r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000240
Identities:SV-78305
V-63815
CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b)
Description: Windows systems maintain a global list of shared system resources such as DOS device names, mutexes, and semaphores. Each type of object is created with a default DACL that specifies who can access the objects with what permissions. If this policy is enabled, the default DACL is stronger, allowing non-admin users to read shared objects, but not modify shared objects that they did not create. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "System objects: Strengthen default permissions of internal system objects (e.g. Symbolic links)" to "Enabled".
Severity:low
Weight:10.0
Reference:

Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072

    • true ('System objects: Strengthen default permissions of internal system objects (e.g. Symbolic Links)' is set to 'Enabled')

  • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager'
  • name must be equal to 'ProtectionMode'

    • value must be equal to '1'

User Account Control must, at minimum, prompt administrators for consent on the secure desktop.

Result:Fail

Identities:V-63819

User Account Control must automatically deny elevation requests for standard users.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220947r569187_rule
Result:Fail
Version:WN10-SO-000255
Identities:V-63821
SV-78311
CCI-002038 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-11)
Description: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. Denying elevation requests from standard user accounts requires tasks that need elevation to be initiated by accounts with administrative privileges. This ensures correct accounts are used on the system for privileged tasks to help mitigate credential theft. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for standard users" to "Automatically deny elevation requests".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:115
Result:false
Title:User Account Control must automatically deny elevation requests for standard users.
Description:User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. Denying elevation requests from standard user accounts requires tasks that need elevation to be initiated by accounts with administrative privileges. This ensures correct accounts are used on the system for privileged tasks to help mitigate credential theft.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • false (All child checks must be true.)
    • false ('User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for standard users' to 'Automatically deny elevation requests', 0)
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:11500 (registry_test)
Result:false

Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System'
  • name must be equal to 'ConsentPromptBehaviorUser'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:11500 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System'
  • name equals 'ConsentPromptBehaviorUser'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '3'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'
Additional Information:Check requirement not met.

User Account Control must be configured to detect application installations and prompt for elevation.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220948r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000260
Identities:SV-78315
V-63825
CCI-001084 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-3.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-3)

  • key must be equal to 'Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System'
  • name must be equal to 'EnableInstallerDetection'

State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System'
  • name equals 'EnableInstallerDetection'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

User Account Control must only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220949r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-SO-000265
Identities:SV-78317
V-63827
CCI-001084 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-3.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-3)
Description: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized. This setting configures Windows to only allow applications installed in a secure location on the file system, such as the Program Files or the Windows\System32 folders, to run with elevated privileges. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "User Account Control: Only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations" to "Enabled".
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4221
Result:true
Title:UAC - UIAccess Application Elevation
Description:User Account Control must only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations.
Class:compliance
Tests:
  • true (All child checks must be true.)
    • true ('User Account Control: Only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations' is set to 'Enabled')
Tests:
Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:422100 (registry_test)
Result:true
Title:'User Account Control: Only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations' is set to 'Enabled'
Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:422100 (registry_object)
Object Requirements:
  • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key must be equal to 'Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System'
  • name must be equal to 'EnableSecureUIAPaths'
State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:422100 (registry_state)
State Requirements:
  • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
  • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
    • value must be equal to '1'
Collected Item Properties:
  • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
  • key equals 'Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System'
  • name equals 'EnableSecureUIAPaths'
  • last_write_time equals '132629252050000000'
  • type equals 'reg_dword'
  • value equals '1'
  • windows_view equals '64_bit'

This setting configures non-UAC compliant applications to run in virtualized file and registry entries in per-user locations, allowing them to run. false

The Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.

Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-220956r569187_rule
Result:Pass
Version:WN10-UR-000005
Identities:V-63843
SV-78333
CCI-002235 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (10))
Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high level capabilities.

Accounts with the "Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller" user right may be able to retrieve the credentials of other accounts from Credential Manager. false
Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller" to be defined but containing no entries (blank).
Severity:medium
Weight:10.0
Reference:
Title:DPMS Target Windows 10
Publisher:DISA
Type:DPMS Target
Subject:Windows 10
Identifier:4072
Definitions:
Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:def:4740
Result:true

Description:Unauthorized accounts must not have the Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller user right.
Class:compliance
